text: The Indian navy has captured 23 Somalian pirates .
marked_sentence: The Indian navy has <mark id="mark_id"> captured </mark> 23 Somalian pirates .
marked_doc: The Indian navy has <mark id="mark_id"> captured </mark> 23 Somalian pirates . <p/>The pirates were about to board a vessel in the Gulf of Aden when they were apprehended . <p/>Last month , India 's navy drew criticism after sinking a Thai fishing trawler that had been commandeered hours earlier by pirates , but the navy says it fired in self-defence . <p/>Somali pirates have become increasingly brazen , and recently seized a Saudi supertanker loaded with e75m worth of crude oil .

text: The Indian navy said it arrested 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden on Saturday , the latest in a series of recent clashes with Somali pirates .
marked_sentence: The Indian navy said it <mark id="mark_id"> arrested </mark> 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden on Saturday , the latest in a series of recent clashes with Somali pirates .
marked_doc: The Indian navy said it <mark id="mark_id"> arrested </mark> 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden on Saturday , the latest in a series of recent clashes with Somali pirates . <p/>Indian forces repulsed the pirates as they were about to board the merchant ship , navy spokesman Commander Nirad Sinha said . <p/>The pirates are from Somalia and Yemen , two countries surrounding the Gulf of Aden , Sinha said . <p/>No further details were immediately available . <p/>Last month , India 's navy drew criticism after sinking a Thai fishing trawler that had been commandeered hours earlier by pirates . <p/>The navy defended its actions , saying it had fired in self-defense . <p/>Somali pirates have become increasingly brazen in recent months , seizing a number of vessels including a Saudi supertanker loaded with $ 100 million worth of crude oil . <p/>Somalia , an impoverished nation caught up in an Islamic insurgency , has not had a functioning government since 1991 .

text: In another successful anti-piracy operation , Navy warship on Saturday repulsed an attack on a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden and nabbed 23 Somali and Yemeni sea brigands , in a show of resolve to weed out the menace that affected maritime trade in the region .
marked_sentence: In another successful anti-piracy operation , Navy warship on Saturday repulsed an attack on a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden and <mark id="mark_id"> nabbed </mark> 23 Somali and Yemeni sea brigands , in a show of resolve to weed out the menace that affected maritime trade in the region .
marked_doc: In another successful anti-piracy operation , Navy warship on Saturday repulsed an attack on a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden and <mark id="mark_id"> nabbed </mark> 23 Somali and Yemeni sea brigands , in a show of resolve to weed out the menace that affected maritime trade in the region . <p/>The pirates on two speed boats had surrounded the merchant vessel flying the Ethiopian flag around noon , when INS Mysore warship intervened and warded off the attack , Navy spokesperson said . <p/>The pirates had fired at the merchant vessel with their small arms , when it sent out a rescue call and the Indian warship , which was sailing nearby moved its Marine Commandos on a helicopter to help the distressed cargo vessel , he said . <p/>The attack took place about 150 nautical miles off Aden and INS Mysore was about 13 nautical miles away from the merchant vessel when it picked up the SOS call . <p/>The Navy flew its Marine Commandos on helicopters to the scene of the pirate attack and rescued the ship. MV Gibe was later escorted to safety , he added . <p/>The Naval commandos also boarded the pirates ' boats and seized seven AK-47 assault rifles , two other rifles , a grenade launcher and 13 fully loaded magazines of ammunition from the 12 Somali and 11 Yemeni pirates on board the two pirate boats . <p/>Further search for other pirates , who fled from the spot following the Indian Naval intervention , was in progress , the spokesperson said . <p/>Last month , Navy warship INS Tabar , a missile-frigate , had sunk a mother ship of the pirates and had also rescued two merchant vessels that were under attack from the sea brigands . <p/>After the successful counter attack on the pirates , INS Mysore later escorted MV Gibe to safety , the Navy spokesperson said . <p/>It also launched further search for some of the pirates who escaped after the launch of the marine commando operation . <p/>Indian Navy has also sought assistance from warships of other countries deployed on anti-piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden to catch the runaway brigands , he said . <p/>New Delhi had taken a serious view of piracy-related incidents in the Gulf of Aden , the primary sea lane for global maritime trade to and fro oil-rich West Asia , following the abduction of MV Stolt Valor , which had 18 Indian sailors on board , by Somali pirates from the region on September 15 , 2008 . <p/>On October 23 , India gave a go-ahead to the Navy 's request for a pro-active approach to counter the outlaws operating with audacity in the region along the Horn of Africa . <p/>The Navy rushed its stealth frigate INS Tabar , which was already deployed nearby to Gulf of Aden on November 2 and since then it rescued an Indian vessel MV Jag Arnav and a Saudi cargo ship on November 11 and also sunk a pirate `mother ship ' on November 19 . <p/>The 'first kill ' , as Navy Chief Admiral Sureesh Mehta had later described the sinking , turned out to be a Thai fishing trawler under the pirates ' control carrying a lot of ammunition and it went up in flames after INS Tabar fired at it in retaliation .

text: The Indian navy captured 23 pirates in the Gulf of Aden after rescuing a merchant vessel that was being hijacked on Saturday , the Defence Ministry said .
marked_sentence: The Indian navy <mark id="mark_id"> captured </mark> 23 pirates in the Gulf of Aden after rescuing a merchant vessel that was being hijacked on Saturday , the Defence Ministry said .
marked_doc: The Indian navy <mark id="mark_id"> captured </mark> 23 pirates in the Gulf of Aden after rescuing a merchant vessel that was being hijacked on Saturday , the Defence Ministry said . <p/>The Indian INS Mysore was patrolling the waters when it received a distress call from Ethiopian-flagged MV Gibe saying two boats were closing in and firing , a Defence Ministry statement said . <p/>`` On sighting the helicopter and Mysore , the boats disengaged from MV Gibe and attempted escape . <p/>Mysore closed the vessels and ordered them to stop . '' <p/>Indian commandos boarded the larger pirate boat , seizing 12 Somali and 11 Yemeni nationals as well as arms and equipment , the statement said . <p/>Piracy in the Gulf of Aden has been on a rise this year , with several high-profile hijackings , including the capture of Saudi supertanker Sirius Star , which was loaded with $ 100 million of crude oil .

text: Navy foils Somali pirate attack off Gulf of Aden
marked_sentence: Navy <mark id="mark_id"> foils </mark> Somali pirate attack off Gulf of Aden
marked_doc: http : / / www . thehindu . com / news / national / navy - foils - somali - pirate - attack - off - gulf - of - aden / article2618961 . ece <p/>Updated : November 11 , 2011 20 : 09 IST <p/>Navy <mark id="mark_id"> foils </mark> Somali pirate attack off Gulf of Aden <p/>The Indian Navy patrolling the Gulf of Aden on Thursday thwarted a multi - boat attack by sea brigands on merchant vessels , apprehending 26 Somali pirates and confiscating arms and ammunition , in the fifth successful anti - piracy operation since September . <p/>At 9 . 25 a . m . on Thursday , navy personnel aboard warship INS Sukanya spotted a group of five suspicious boats speedily approaching the merchant vessels of her group . <p/>“ The warship immediately altered ( its direction ) towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them . <p/>On seeing the resolve evident in the warship ’ s action and probably mindful of the reputation for resolute action that the Indian Navy justly enjoys in such deployments , the pirate skiffs reversed course and tried to flee the area , ” Captain Manohar Nambiar , Chief Public Relations Officer , Defence , said . <p/>While two of them managed to escape , INS Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three boats and , in a well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action , nabbed 26 Somali pirates with six AK 47 rifles , 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition . <p/>This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by INS Sukanya in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden that commenced in September , the Navy said . <p/>INS Sukanya , currently deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command , was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor when the incident happened . <p/>The timely operation by INS Sukanya resulted , once again , in foiling the pirates ’ attempt to attack merchant vessels transiting the busy sea lane through which over nearly $100 billion worth India ’ s external trade passes each year , Captain Nambiar said . <p/>In their five operations so far , the personnel on board the warship have confiscated 14 AK - 47 Rifles , 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition , he said . <p/>Indian Navy is part of the international effort to ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade in this high - risk stronghold of modern - day piracy .

text: The Indian navy captured 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the lawless waters of the Gulf of Aden and a German naval helicopter thwarted another attack Saturday on a freighter being chased by speedboats off Yemen .
marked_sentence: The Indian navy captured 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the lawless waters of the Gulf of Aden and a German naval helicopter <mark id="mark_id"> thwarted </mark> another attack Saturday on a freighter being chased by speedboats off Yemen .
marked_doc: The Indian navy captured 23 pirates who threatened a merchant vessel in the lawless waters of the Gulf of Aden and a German naval helicopter <mark id="mark_id"> thwarted </mark> another attack Saturday on a freighter being chased by speedboats off Yemen . <p/>The successes came days before Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice was to ask the United Nations to authorize `` all necessary measures '' against increasingly bold Somalian pirates operating in one of the world 's busiest shipping lanes . <p/>An Indian navy ship , the INS Mysore , was escorting merchant ships in waters off Somalia 's coast Saturday when it received a distress call from seamen on board the MV Gibe , who said they were being fired on by two boats that were approaching fast . <p/>The Mysore and its helicopter sped to the scene , and the pirate boats attempted to escape when they saw them , according to a statement from the Indian government . <p/>Indian marine commandoes boarded the pirate boats and seized `` a substantial cache of arms and equipment , '' including seven AK-47 assault rifles , three machine guns , a rocket-propelled grenade launcher and other weapons , the statement said . <p/>They also found a GPS receiver and other equipment . <p/>The pirates were from Somalia and Yemen , two countries on the coast of the Gulf of Aden . <p/>The Gibe was flying an Ethiopian flag but little else was known about it , the Indian statement said . <p/>Last month , India 's navy drew criticism after sinking a Thai fishing trawler that had been commandeered hours earlier by pirates . <p/>At least one Thai crew member was killed in the attack , which the Indian navy had originally announced by saying it had sunk a pirate `` mother ship . '' <p/>The Indian navy defended its actions , saying it had fired in self-defense . <p/>Somali pirates have become increasingly brazen and recently seized a Saudi supertanker loaded with $ 100 million of crude oil . <p/>Many of the vessels are taken to pirate-controlled regions in Somalia , where they are held for ransom . <p/>It was not immediately clear what would happen to the pirates captured by the Indians , or where they would be taken . <p/>The statement said only that the prisoners and their weapons would be `` handed over to appropriate authorities ashore . '' <p/>Most foreign navies patrolling the Somali coast have been reluctant to detain suspects because of uncertainties over where they would face trial , since Somalia has no effective central government or legal system . <p/>Also on Saturday , a German military spokesman said a navy frigate had chased away pirates in speedboats pursuing an Ethiopian freighter off the coast of Yemen . <p/>The German frigate responded to a distress call from the freighter , and a helicopter took off from the deck to investigate . <p/>The pirates turned away from the freighter as the helicopter flew overhead , said the spokesman , who declined to give his name in line with military policy . <p/>An estimated 1,500 pirates are based in Somalia 's semiautonomous Puntland region , raking in millions of dollars . <p/>Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice will present a draft Security Council resolution next week asking the United Nations to authorize `` all necessary measures '' against piracy from Somalia . <p/>However , the commander of the U.S. Navy 's 5th Fleet expressed doubt Friday about the wisdom of launching attacks against Somali pirates on land , as the draft proposes . <p/>U.S. Vice Adm. Bill Gortney told reporters that it is difficult to identify pirates , and the potential for killing innocent civilians `` can not be overestimated . '' <p/>The threat of pirates recently prompted a German cruise ship to evacuate some 420 passengers and crew after the company decided not to risk their safety as the ship passed through the Gulf of Aden . <p/>The passengers and crew have rejoined the M/S Columbus - which is on a six-month round-the-world trip - in Oman 's port of Salalah after three days in Dubai , Hamburg-based cruise operator Hapag-Lloyd said Saturday . <p/>The ship and a limited crew made it through the gulf without incident , a company spokeswoman said .

text: New Delhi / Mumbai : An Indian warship foiled a five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden on Friday capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons .
marked_sentence: New Delhi / Mumbai : An Indian warship <mark id="mark_id"> foiled </mark> a five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden on Friday capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons .
marked_doc: http : / / www . pardaphash . com / news / indian - navy - captures - 26 - somali - pirates - in - gulf - of - aden / 683284 . html# . UlFH6xaKwlI <p/>Indian Navy captures 26 Somali pirates in Gulf of Aden <p/>Published on : Fri , 11 Nov 2011 at 09 : 56 IST <p/>New Delhi / Mumbai : An Indian warship <mark id="mark_id"> foiled </mark> a five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden on Friday capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons . <p/>Patrol vessel INS Sukanya was escorting the five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor in the Gulf of Aden on Thursday morning when the warship's crew noticed the five - boat pirate formation approaching the cargo ship group . <p/>"The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them , " the officer said , adding the pirate skiffs then reversed course and tried to flee the area . <p/>"While two of the skiffs and its crew managed to get away , Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three skiffs and carried out well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action . <p/>"The three boats had a total of 26 Somali crew on board . <p/>During the operation , six AK - 47 rifles , 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated , " the officer said . <p/>He said that in addition , the naval boarding party also found a host of other equipment such as grapnels , ladders and rope - handling gloves , all of which confirmed their intent to attack and hijack the merchant vessels . <p/>This anti - piracy action by INS Sukanya was the fifth successful operation by its crew during its current patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden since September this year . <p/>The officer said that INS Sukanya has seized a total of 14 AK - 47 rifles , 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition during the five operations it carried out there .

text: The Indian navy captured 23 piracy suspects who tried to take over a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden , between the Horn of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula , Indian officials said .
marked_sentence: The Indian navy <mark id="mark_id"> captured </mark> 23 piracy suspects who tried to take over a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden , between the Horn of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula , Indian officials said .
marked_doc: The Indian navy <mark id="mark_id"> captured </mark> 23 piracy suspects who tried to take over a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden , between the Horn of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula , Indian officials said . <p/>Piracy suspects raise their hands in surrender as an Indian navy boat approaches . <p/>In addition to the 12 Somali and 11 Yemeni suspects , the Indian navy seized two small boats and `` a substantial cache of arms and equipment , '' the military said in a statement . <p/>Among the seized items were seven AK-47 automatic rifles , three other automatic weapons and 13 loaded magazines ; a rocket-propelled grenade launcher along with rockets , cartridges and grenades ; up to three outboard motors and a global positioning system receiver . <p/>Pirate attacks in the waters off Somalia have increased this year , with armed men staging increasingly bold attacks on ever-larger targets . <p/>This year , pirates have attacked nearly 100 vessels off Somalia 's coast and hijacked nearly 40 , the International Maritime Bureau said . <p/>The Indian warship Mysore , which carried out Saturday 's operation , is on anti-piracy patrol in the Gulf of Aden , the release said . <p/>The Mysore received a distress call Saturday morning from the MV Gibe , a merchant vessel sailing under an Ethiopian flag . <p/>The Gibe reported that two boats were firing small arms at it . <p/>The merchant ship , which was 13 nautical miles from the Mysore , fired back with small arms onboard the vessel . <p/>The Mysore changed course toward the Gibe and launched an armed helicopter , the Indian military said . <p/>Upon seeing the helicopter and the Mysore closing in , the attackers broke off and tried to flee , the release said . <p/>The warship caught up to the boats , the larger of which was described as a 24- to 30-foot dhow , a traditional Arab sailboat . <p/>The dhow , identified as bearing the name Salahaddin , was towing a smaller skiff . <p/>Indian sailors boarded the Salahaddin , the military said , and the 23 suspects surrendered peacefully . <p/>The suspects , weapons , ammunition and equipment will be handed over to authorities , and the Mysore will return to patrol duties , India said . <p/>Last month , the Indian navy said it had sunk a pirate `` mother vessel '' in the Gulf of Aden . <p/>The ship 's owner said the sunken vessel was a Thai trawler that was being seized by pirates when an Indian warship fired on it . <p/>Sixteen crew members were aboard the ship , said Wicharn Sirichaiekawat , owner of the Ekawat Nava 5 . <p/>Two have been accounted for . <p/>One crewman was found alive after six days adrift in the Gulf of Aden , and one is confirmed dead , the ship 's owner said . <p/>Indian authorities insisted that their ship , the frigate INS Tabar , had acted against a pirate vessel that had threatened to attack it . <p/>`` We fired in self-defense and in response to firing upon our vessel , '' Commodore Nirad Sinha , a navy spokesman , told CNN . <p/>`` It was a pirate vessel in the international waters , and its stance was aggressive . '' <p/>He said the ship the Tabar fired on was laden with ammunition . <p/>All sorts of vessels -- freight and cargo ships , cruise liners and private yachts -- have been attacked in the waters off Somalia . <p/>In many hijackings , pirates take the crew and passengers hostage and demand a ransom . <p/>Just this month , Somali pirates captured two Yemeni fishing boats and 22 Yemeni fishermen in the Gulf of Aden , Yemen 's official news agency SABA reported . <p/>A day earlier , the German cruise liner MS Columbus said it would fly its 246 passengers and most of its crew over the Gulf of Aden instead of through it to avoid any pirate attack . <p/>The United States is reportedly circulating a proposal in the U.N. Security Council that would allow military forces to enter Somali territory in `` hot pursuit '' of pirates . <p/>The Pentagon said Friday , however , that there are no plans for U.S. forces to go ashore in pursuit of pirates in Somalia .

marked_doc: http : / / www . foxnews . com / story / 2007 / 04 / 11 / detroit - office - shooter - charged - with - murder - attempted - murder / <p/>Detroit Office Shooter Charged With Murder , Attempted Murder <p/>Published April 11 , 2007 <p/>A man fired four days earlier from his job as an accountant walked into his old office , passed by the receptionist and made his way to a manager's office with the purpose of killing him with a shotgun , a police sergeant said Wednesday during the man's arraignment . <p/>When Monday's violence had concluded , the receptionist - - Madeline Kafoury - - was shot dead and two managers , Paul Riva and Alan Steinberg , were wounded . <p/>Steinberg was shot in the hip and has spoken to police about the attack , while Riva had not yet regained consciousness and was on a ventilator . <p/>The man accused of <mark id="mark_id"> shooting </mark> his three former co - workers is Anthony LaCalamita III , a 38 - year - old Troy resident who was fired from Gordon Advisors on Thursday . <p/>A not guilty plea was entered on LaCalamita's behalf during Wednesday's hearing . <p/>LaCalamita is charged with first - degree murder in the death of Kafoury , 63 , of Warren . <p/>He also is charged with two counts of intent to murder in the shootings of Riva , 47 , of Sterling Heights , and Steinberg , 48 , of Macomb County's Bruce Township - - as well as three counts of possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and one count of fleeing and eluding police . <p/>LaCalamita was asked by Judge Michael A . Martone if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder . <p/>He responded , "Yes , " to the series of questions posed by Martone . <p/>The judge ordered him held without bond pending his next court hearing April 19 . <p/>Kafoury's loved ones attended Wednesday's arraignment , and her daughter , Charlene - - holding a picture of Kafoury - - sobbed loudly during the proceedings . <p/>"She didn't do it . <p/>She didn't fire him , " Charlene Kafoury said . <p/>LaCalamita sat nearby and did not react to the comments from the victim's daughter . <p/>After the hearing , Charlene Kafoury and other loved ones gathered for a news conference . <p/>"She wasn't just a receptionist . . . . <p/>She was our mom and the grandmother of our children , " said Charlie Kafoury , Charlene's brother . <p/>"She was an essential point of our lives , " said a tearful Charlie Kafoury , who had difficulty getting out his words . <p/>A number of loved ones stood behind him and cried audibly . <p/>They engaged in a group hug after the news conference . <p/>Troy police Sgt . Barry Whiteside said LaCalamita first stopped at the reception area after 10 a . m . on Monday and talked to Kafoury , then entered Steinberg's office and asked him twice if he wanted to be shot . <p/>Steinberg told police he thought LaCalamita was holding a toy gun . <p/>"He didn't think it was real until he saw the shotgun was being racked , " Whiteside said . <p/>After shooting Steinberg , Whiteside said LaCalamita walked down the hall and into Riva's office . <p/>Kafoury , who was standing in the doorway of Riva's office , was struck in her midsection , Whiteside said . <p/>She fell to the floor and died from her wounds , he said . <p/>LaCalamita then fired one round at Riva , who was struck in the upper chest area . <p/>Riva tried to step over Kafoury and collapsed in the hall , Whiteside said . <p/>Police said LaCalamita targeted the two managers and also may have intended to shoot another one . <p/>"There is a suspicion that there might have been a third upper management official he was seeking , " said Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck . <p/>The man , whom police did not identify , was not in the office suite at the time of the attack . <p/>Police said the shotgun was armed with buckshot that contained nine pellets in each shot . <p/>Some of the pellets hit the victims and some did not , police said . <p/>LaCalamita was fired from his position as a general accountant last Thursday because of poor performance , police said . <p/>According to receipts police recovered from his apartment , LaCalamita purchased the shotgun around 3 : 45 p . m . on Friday . <p/>LaCalamita was denied a handgun permit in March , said Scherlinck , who would not say why the permit was denied . <p/>LaCalamita was arrested Monday afternoon after leading police on a chase north along Interstate 75 in Genesee County in which speeds reached 120 mph . <p/>A 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three live shells were found in the silver Ford Fusion LaCalamita was driving . <p/>Police said they found a long , cardboard box consistent to one that would hold a shotgun , as well as empty shell boxes , in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment during a search Monday evening .

text: Sacked worker shoots ex - colleagues
arg1: Gordon Advisors PC receptionist Madeline Kafoury/Gordon Advisors PC partner Paul Riva/Gordon Advisors PC partner Alan Steinberg
marked_sentence: Sacked worker <mark id="mark_id"> shoots </mark> ex - colleagues
marked_doc: http : / / www . theage . com . au / articles / 2007 / 04 / 10 / 1175971051701 . html <p/>Sacked worker <mark id="mark_id"> shoots </mark> ex - colleagues <p/>April 10 , 2007 - 7 : 07AM <p/>A man suspected of shooting three people , killing one , at a suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week was arrested after a high - speed chase a few hours after the attack this morning , authorities said . <p/>Police said they had located Anthony LaCalamita , 38 , on the Interstate 75 highway , north of the office building where the shootings took place . <p/>Sheriff's deputies and state police chased him for 48km , including through a construction zone , at speeds up to 193km / h before he finally pulled over after about 15 minutes , Genesee County Sheriff Robert J Pickell said . <p/>"He probably realised if he didn't , he was going to be shot , " Undersheriff James Gage said . <p/>LaCalamita said nothing after officers surrounded him , Pickell said , describing the suspect as "subdued . <p/>Very , very , very subdued" . <p/>Officers found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three live shells in the vehicle , Pickell said . <p/>Witnesses said the shooter used a shotgun or a rifle , Troy police Lieutenant Gerry Scherlinck said . <p/>Some witnesses told police that when the shooter walked into the office on the building's second floor at about 10am today , he looked as if he was trying to hide something , Troy Police Chief Charles Craft said . <p/>Police could not say how many shots were fired . <p/>"I'm not positive all three of the people were targeted , but there appeared to be some purpose , " Craft said . <p/>The families of the two wounded men requested "total privacy" , and the hospital would not release any details about their conditions , Beaumont Hospital spokeswoman Ilene Wolfe said . <p/>She said the third victim died on the way to the hospital . <p/>LaCalamita was listed among the professional staff on the website of Gordon Advisers , a public accounting and business consulting firm in the building . <p/>Calls to Gordon Advisers were not answered this afternoon , and a recording said the offices were closed . <p/>The 15 , 800 - square - metre building houses a number of businesses , including law offices and the accounting firm . <p/>Police at first told workers to stay in their offices but a short time later evacuated the building , about 24km north of Detroit . <p/>Bill Adgate , who works at LPL Financial inside the building , said he had hunkered down inside the office for a couple of hours with furniture pushed up against the door . <p/>He said police told the group to stay put until officers allowed them to leave . <p/>"It's tough . <p/>I want to get out , " Adgate said by telephone .

text: Employees at a Vancouver wholesaler were coping Saturday with the death of their boss , who was gunned down at their office Christmas party .
marked_sentence: Employees at a Vancouver wholesaler were coping Saturday with the death of their boss , who was <mark id="mark_id"> gunned down </mark> at their office Christmas party .
marked_doc: Employees at a Vancouver wholesaler were coping Saturday with the death of their boss , who was <mark id="mark_id"> gunned down </mark> at their office Christmas party . <p/>A man facing murder charges in a Christmas party shooting was on suicide watch Monday as friends and family of paid glowing tribute to his alleged victim . <p/>Those who knew Benjamin David Banky , 40 , were still in shock three days after he was gunned down during what was supposed to be a Christmas celebration at his office . <p/>His accused killer , Eric Kirkpatrick , made a brief appearance in Vancouver provincial court Monday on a charge of first-degree murder . <p/>Banky was CEO of TallGrass Distribution Ltd. , a wholesaler of natural health products , which remained closed Monday . <p/>`` He was incredibly bright , a very caring person and incredibly family-oriented , '' said Nancy O'Higgins , a longtime family friend . <p/>O'Higgins and her husband Eric , both retired journalists , knew Ben as a baby because they worked in the media in Ontario with Ben 's father Jake before both families moved west , six months apart . <p/>The O'Higgins ' attended Ben 's wedding a couple of years ago on Hornby Island , one of the Gulf Islands where his parents now live . <p/>`` They were n't married very long , just a couple of years . '' <p/>She said Ben and his wife grew up as neighbours on Hornby Island . <p/>`` That was how Ben and Linda knew each other . '' <p/>Ben attended school in his early years in White Rock but got most of his education in Victoria where his father worked for Broadcast News , which is now The Canadian Press . <p/>She said he travelled to China for awhile , where he studied Mandarin and was quite fluent . <p/>`` I was so incredibly impressed that he spoke Mandarin that that really stuck in my head , '' said O'Higgins . <p/>John Banky , Ben 's older brother , spoke briefly from the parents ' home Monday , alluding to his brother 's musical abilities . <p/>`` He spoke a few languages and could play any instrument made by man , '' said his brother . <p/>While the family tried to deal with the loss , Kirkpatrick made a brief appearance in court . <p/>His lawyer , Richard Fowler , told the court his client is on suicide watch at the North Fraser Pretrial Centre in Port Coquitlam . <p/>Fowler described conditions at the centre as unacceptable , saying his client is double-bunked with a man who is withdrawing from a drug addiction and the cell is cold . <p/>Much of B.C. is in the grips of a cold spell , with unusually cold temperatures in the Vancouver area that are well below freezing . <p/>Kirkpatrick , who has long grey hair flowing down to his shoulders and a long grey beard , was dressed in red , prison-issue coveralls . <p/>He stood quietly in the prisoner 's box listening to the proceedings . <p/>The sixty-one-year-old was arrested Friday , not long after Banky was shot to death . <p/>Outside court , Fowler said Kirkpatrick is `` not doing very well . '' <p/>`` He is placed in a double bunk with somebody who is withdrawing from drugs . <p/>He can not sleep . <p/>It 's freezing cold . <p/>The problem is that these institutions are too full . '' <p/>`` He 's presumed innocent and he should be treated better . '' <p/>Lon Wood , another retired Victoria journalist who knew Ben 's father from their days working in Victoria , said he met Ben and the other children through their parents . <p/>`` They are a very close family . '' <p/>John Paul Fraser of National Public Relations , which is working for TallGrass , said the family is not speaking publicly yet . <p/>At a weekend news conference , city police spokesman Const . <p/>Tim Fanning said Kirkpatrick had been let go from TallGrass on Thursday . <p/>Fanning did n't know how long the suspect had worked at the business . <p/>The other people at the office party were able to escape without injury , Fanning said . <p/>`` The shock was tremendous but all the other people in the business - and a dozen other people who were there for a Christmas party - managed to get out safely , '' Fanning said . <p/>The shocked party-goers were put on buses and taken to police headquarters where witness statements were taken , he said . <p/>He said counsellors have been made available to them .

text: One man is dead after being shot by a gunman who marched into a company Christmas party Friday night .
marked_sentence: One man is dead after being <mark id="mark_id"> shot </mark> by a gunman who marched into a company Christmas party Friday night .
marked_doc: One man is dead after being <mark id="mark_id"> shot </mark> by a gunman who marched into a company Christmas party Friday night . <p/>Vancouver police have arrested a 61-year-old former employee after the shooting at Tallgrass Distributors Ltd. , an organic supplements and health product store in the Mount Pleasant neighbourhood near downtown Vancouver . <p/>`` A man who apparently had just been let go from his job there came in , shot and killed another man , '' Vancouver police Const . <p/>Tim Fanning told a news conference . <p/>`` There was at least a dozen other people on the scene . <p/>They managed to get out . <p/>`` Our negotiators got on the phone with him right away , and fortunately were able to talk him down from his very , very excited and upset state . '' <p/>Fanning said no one else was injured . <p/>Offices around the neighbourhood were shut down during the police standoff that lasted two hours before the gunman gave himself up . <p/>Staff at Fiji Island Auto , across the street from the building where the shooting took place , were told at 5 : 30 p.m. local time to leave the premises . <p/>John Christie , head of house production for Paperny Films , located down the street , said they were planning to hold an office party upstairs when someone heard shots fired . <p/>`` We have been asked by the police to stay away from the windows and we 've been forced to go downstairs , '' Christie said .

text: A 61-year-old man was charged with first-degree murder Saturday after allegedly opening fire at his former employers ' office Christmas party in Vancouver , killing one man , police said .
marked_sentence: A 61-year-old man was charged with first-degree murder Saturday after allegedly <mark id="mark_id"> opening fire </mark> at his former employers ' office Christmas party in Vancouver , killing one man , police said .
marked_doc: A 61-year-old man was charged with first-degree murder Saturday after allegedly <mark id="mark_id"> opening fire </mark> at his former employers ' office Christmas party in Vancouver , killing one man , police said . <p/>Constable Tim Fanning said Eric Allen Kirkpatrick , who had recently been fired from his job , is accused of fatally shooting Benjamin David Banky , 40 . <p/>Fanning said at least a dozen people were at the party when the gunman entered about 4 p.m . <p/>All but Kirkpatrick escaped without injury . <p/>`` Police locked down the neighborhood and negotiated with the suspect , who gave himself up to police just after 6 : 00 p.m. , '' Fanning said in a statement . <p/>The business at the location of the shooting is listed as TallGrass Distribution Ltd. , a natural health product supplier .

text: Sheriff : Michigan office shooting kills 1 , injures 2
arg1: Gordon Advisors PC receptionist Madeline Kafoury/Gordon Advisors PC partner Paul Riva/Gordon Advisors PC partner Alan Steinberg
marked_sentence: Sheriff : Michigan office <mark id="mark_id"> shooting </mark> kills 1 , injures 2
marked_doc: http : / / edition . cnn . com / 2007 / US / 04 / 09 / michigan . shooting / <p/>Sheriff : Michigan office <mark id="mark_id"> shooting </mark> kills 1 , injures 2 <p/>POSTED : 1052 GMT ( 1852 HKT ) , April 10 , 2007 <p/>A Michigan man shot to death one person and injured two others Monday at the suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week , police said . <p/>The suspect , 38 - year - old Anthony LaCalamita , was "deliberately seeking out these individuals , " according to Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck . <p/>A female receptionist died and two men , believed to be "management level employees , " underwent surgery for gunshot wounds at Royal Oak Beaumont Hospital , Scherlinck said . <p/>A 50 - year - old man from Dexter , Michigan , tipped off authorities to LaCalamita's location after hearing a description of the suspect's vehicle - - a 2007 silver Ford Fusion - - on the radio . <p/>The man , who did not want to be identified , called 911 when he realized the vehicle directly next to him matched the description on the radio , according to Genesee County Sheriff Robert Pickell . <p/>Police attempted to stop the vehicle as it entered Vienna township , but LaCalamita would not pull over , Pickell said . <p/>LaCalamita drove across several counties , at speeds up to 120 miles per hour , surrendering only after authorities boxed in his car on Interstate 75 in Saginaw , Michigan . <p/>He surrendered "peacefully and without incident , " Pickell said . <p/>Upon arrest , police seized a shotgun and several shells , he said . <p/>LaCalamita is being held in the Genesee County jail and is expected to be handed over to the Detroit police . <p/>A Web site for the public accounting firm Gordon Advisors in the building lists LaCalamita as an employee . <p/>"We heard gunshots . . . . <p/>We're on the third floor , barricaded in , " Bill Adgate , who works for LPL Financial in the office building , told CNN affiliate WDIV - TV as the search went on for the gunman . <p/>"We put a conference table in front of the front door with a bunch of chairs , " Adgate told WDIV , a Detroit station . <p/>"We have four entrances - - three entrances to our offices . <p/>We put file cabinets and things of that nature in front of it . " <p/>Monday's shooting follows two last week in public places in Atlanta , Georgia , and Seattle , Washington . <p/>In Atlanta's CNN Center on Tuesday , police say a man shot to death his former girlfriend just downstairs from the center's Omni Hotel and outside the CNN . com newsroom . <p/>On Monday on the Seattle campus of the University of Washington , a gunman killed his former girlfriend and then himself . <p/>In early March , a gunman shot and wounded three people at a printing facility near Los Angeles , California , before killing himself . <p/>Police said he was a disgruntled employee of the facility in Signal Hill , California . <p/>In February , a gunman killed five people and injured several others at a shopping mall in Salt Lake City , Utah , before an off - duty policeman killed the shooter .

text: Police allege Eric Allen Kirkpatrick , 61 , opened fire at the TallGrass Distribution Ltd Christmas party , killing Benjamin David Banky , 40 .
marked_sentence: Police allege Eric Allen Kirkpatrick , 61 , <mark id="mark_id"> opened fire </mark> at the TallGrass Distribution Ltd Christmas party , killing Benjamin David Banky , 40 .
marked_doc: A man has been charged with first-degree murder after a shooting at an office Christmas party in Vancouver Friday . <p/>Police allege Eric Allen Kirkpatrick , 61 , <mark id="mark_id"> opened fire </mark> at the TallGrass Distribution Ltd Christmas party , killing Benjamin David Banky , 40 . <p/>Banky was the CEO of TallGrass Distribution Ltd. , a natural health products company . <p/>At least a dozen employees had been celebrating when the gunman , who had been recently laid off , entered the party and began firing a gun , according to Vancouver Police spokesperson Const. Tim Fanning . <p/>The other partygoers managed to escape unharmed . <p/>`` The shock was tremendous but all the other people in the business - and there another dozen other people who were there for a Christmas party - managed to get out safely , '' Fanning said . <p/>Police locked down the neighbourhood before the suspect turned himself in around 6 p.m . <p/>Police said Kirkpatrick was let go on Dec. 11 . <p/>A resident who lives in a nearby apartment building told The Canadian Press that he did not hear gunshots , but saw a woman run from the party and into a nearby auto repair shop , where it appears she called for help . <p/>`` All of a sudden in my front yard there were five totally decked out , geared up riot squad officers with guns out of the holster , aiming at the second floor of the building right beside us , '' Luke Pigeon said . <p/>`` I tried to open up my door and they said close your door , lock your door . '' <p/>Mark Pinder told The Canadian Press that police ordered a group of film studio employees into the basement of their building , which was across the street from the party . <p/>The group was just about to celebrate the completion of a project when police came knocking , he said . <p/>`` People grabbed a couple of bowls of chips and dip and we just sort of moved the party downstairs , '' Pinder said . <p/>`` Some people seemed quite concerned but there was n't anyone freaking out or crying . <p/>Everyone was calling their family and making sure that people knew they were OK . '' <p/>Pigeon said police spent about two hours negotiating with the suspect before bringing him into custody . <p/>`` They cuffed him on the ground and they took him into a cruiser , '' he said . <p/>`` He was giving them a bit of grief , he was saying that his cuffs hurt , but he was following orders . '' <p/>Employees who had been at the party at the time of the shooting are receiving counselling from the Vancouver police victim 's services team . <p/>`` I can not emphasize enough how traumatic this would have been for the people in there to see one of their co-workers gunned down , so we 're going to do all we can to help these people though a very , very difficult time , '' Fanning said .

text: A former employee recently let go from his job opened fire at an office Christmas party Friday , killing one person , police said .
marked_sentence: A former employee recently let go from his job <mark id="mark_id"> opened fire </mark> at an office Christmas party Friday , killing one person , police said .
marked_doc: A former employee recently let go from his job <mark id="mark_id"> opened fire </mark> at an office Christmas party Friday , killing one person , police said . <p/>`` The suspect , a 61-year-old man , entered the business , which had at least a dozen people inside enjoying a Christmas party , `` police said in a statement . <p/>Police Const. Tim Fanning said the gunman entered the party around 4 p.m . <p/>One man was shot and killed but the other partygoers managed to escape and no one else was injured . <p/>`` Police 'locked down ' the neighborhood and negotiated with the suspect , who gave himself up to police just after 6 : 00 p.m. , '' Fanning said in the statement . <p/>The business at the location of the shooting is listed as TallGrass Distribution Ltd. , a natural health product supplier . <p/>Luke Pigeon , who lives in an apartment building next door , said he did n't hear a gunshot but heard a commotion outside his window . <p/>`` It was n't typical , crazy noise that sometimes happens . <p/>You got the feeling there was something definitely , definitely wrong , '' Pigeon told The Canadian Press . <p/>He looked out his window and saw someone fleeing the building next door . <p/>`` All of a sudden in my front yard there were five totally decked out , geared up riot squad officers with guns out of the holster , aiming at the second floor of the building right beside us , '' Pigeon said . <p/>He spent the next two hours in his apartment , with armed officers about 10 feet from his front window as police tried to negotiate with the suspect . <p/>Finally , he heard activity as the gunman gave himself up . <p/>`` They cuffed him on the ground and they took him into a cruiser , '' he said . <p/>`` He was giving them a bit of grief , he was saying that his cuffs hurt . '' <p/>Police said the victim 's name would not be released until next of kin had been notified . <p/>They said the name of the suspect would be released after he is formally charged .

text: A jury on Tuesday convicted a man charged in an April 2007 shooting at a Troy accounting firm that left a receptionist dead and two managing partners wounded .
marked_sentence: A jury on Tuesday convicted a man charged in an April 2007 shooting at a Troy accounting firm that <mark id="mark_id"> left </mark> a receptionist dead and two managing partners wounded .
marked_doc: http : / / blog . mlive . com / grpress / 2008 / 04 / jury _ finds _ suspect _ in _ troy _ off . html <p/>Jury finds suspect in Troy office shooting guilty <p/>on April 30 , 2008 at 4 : 31 AM , updated April 30 , 2008 at 8 : 33 AM <p/>A jury on Tuesday convicted a man charged in an April 2007 shooting at a Troy accounting firm that <mark id="mark_id"> left </mark> a receptionist dead and two managing partners wounded . <p/>Anthony LaCalamita III was found guilty of first - degree murder and assault with intent to murder in the shotgun slaying of 63 - year - old Madeline Kafoury and assault with intent to kill in the shootings of Paul Riva and Alan Steinberg at the accounting firm . <p/>Defense attorney Jerome Fenton argued LaCalamita's extensive history of mental illness was to blame . <p/>Assistant Oakland County Prosecutor Rob Novy said the 39 - year - old Troy man shot his former co - workers because he was furious over his firing four days earlier .

marked_doc: http : / / usatoday30 . usatoday . com / news / nation / 2007 - 04 - 11 - office - shooting _ N . htm <p/>Mich . accountant charged with murder in office <mark id="mark_id"> shootings </mark> <p/>Updated 4 / 11 / 2007 1 : 26 PM <p/>A fired accountant accused of wounding two former bosses in a shotgun attack and killing a receptionist who tried to stop him was arraigned Wednesday on murder and other charges . <p/>Anthony LaCalamita III , 38 , had been arrested following a high - speed chase a few hours after the Monday morning shootings at Gordon Advisors in suburban Detroit . <p/>During his arraignment Wednesday , authorities described what witnesses saw inside the offices that morning . <p/>LaCalamita was hiding the gun when he walked into accounting firm offices , stopped briefly at the reception desk and then entered Alan Steinberg's office , Troy police Sgt . Barry Whiteside testified . <p/>Steinberg , a partner in the firm , told police LaCalamita loaded a shell into the shotgun's chamber and shot him in the hip , then walked toward the office of Paul Riva , another partner . <p/>When receptionist Madeline Kafoury tried to stop him at Riva's door , the gunman fatally shot her in the midsection , Whiteside said . <p/>LaCalamita then fired at Riva , hitting him in the upper chest , and left the building , Whiteside said . <p/>Riva had yet to regain consciousness Wednesday and was on a ventilator , police said . <p/>As Whiteside talked in court , Kafoury's adult daughter sobbed uncontrollably . <p/>"She wasn't just a receptionist . . . . <p/>She was our mom and the grandmother of our children , " Kafoury's son , Charlie , said after the hearing . <p/>"She was an essential point of our lives . " <p/>Not guilty pleas were entered on LaCalamita's behalf to charges of first - degree murder , intent to murder , possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and fleeing and eluding police . <p/>Asked by the judge if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder , he responded "Yes . " <p/>The judge ordered him held without bail pending his next court hearing April 19 . <p/>Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck said Riva and Steinberg appeared to have been the targets in the shootings . <p/>LaCalamita had been fired last Thursday as a general accountant at the firm and bought a shotgun and shells on Friday , Scherlinck said . <p/>He said police found a box consistent with one that would hold a shotgun , as well as empty shell boxes , in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment Monday evening . <p/>When LaCalamita was arrested , police said they found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three shells in his vehicle . <p/>Matthew Roth , executive staff attorney for the prosecutor's office , said his office had not been told if LaCalamita or his family had retained a lawyer . <p/>LaCalamita is married , but his wife , Michele , released a statement saying they had been separated for about three weeks . <p/>According to real estate records obtained by The Associated Press , the couple during the past year actively bought and sold suburban homes . <p/>Records list Michele LaCalamita as the owner of all four . <p/>Riva , 47 , of Sterling Heights and Steinberg , 48 , of Macomb County's Bruce Township , were being treated at Beaumont Hospital , where spokeswoman Ilene Wolff said the families of the wounded men asked that their conditions and other information not be released . <p/>Gordon Advisors issued a statement Tuesday expressing condolences to the families of the victims . <p/>"We are especially devastated by the death of Madeline Kafoury and our hearts go out to her family . <p/>Maddie was revered by clients , employees and owners alike , " the statement said . <p/>"We express our gratitude to our employees for their bravery on Monday and for their support in the days to come . "

" <p/>The judge ordered him held without bail pending his next court hearing April 19 . <p/>Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck said Riva and Steinberg appeared to have been the targets in the shootings . <p/>LaCalamita had been fired last Thursday as a general accountant at the firm and bought a shotgun and shells on Friday , Scherlinck said . <p/>He said police found a box consistent with one that would hold a shotgun , as well as empty shell boxes , in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment Monday evening . <p/>When LaCalamita was arrested , police said they found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three shells in his vehicle . <p/>Matthew Roth , executive staff attorney for the prosecutor's office , said his office had not been told if LaCalamita or his family had retained a lawyer . <p/>LaCalamita is married , but his wife , Michele , released a statement saying they had been separated for about three weeks . <p/>According to real estate records obtained by The Associated Press , the couple during the past year actively bought and sold suburban homes . <p/>Records list Michele LaCalamita as the owner of all four . <p/>Riva , 47 , of Sterling Heights and Steinberg , 48 , of Macomb County's Bruce Township , were being treated at Beaumont Hospital , where spokeswoman Ilene Wolff said the families of the wounded men asked that their conditions and other information not be released . <p/>Gordon Advisors issued a statement Tuesday expressing condolences to the families of the victims . <p/>"We are especially devastated by the death of Madeline Kafoury and our hearts go out to her family . <p/>Maddie was revered by clients , employees and owners alike , " the statement said . <p/>"We express our gratitude to our employees for their bravery on Monday and for their support in the days to come . "

text: One man is dead after an ex-employee opened fire at his company 's Christmas party at a Vancouver , B.C. business Friday night .
marked_sentence: One man is dead after an ex-employee <mark id="mark_id"> opened fire </mark> at his company 's Christmas party at a Vancouver , B.C. business Friday night .
marked_doc: One man is dead after an ex-employee <mark id="mark_id"> opened fire </mark> at his company 's Christmas party at a Vancouver , B.C. business Friday night . <p/>Just past 4 p.m. Friday , Vancouver Police received a call of a man being shot at 40 East 5th Ave. at a business called Tall Grass Distribution Limited . <p/>Police say a recently laid off employee opened fire shortly after entering the party , killing one male employee. At least a dozen workers were at the party at the time . <p/>A 61-year-old man surrendered to police shortly after 6 p.m . <p/>He is currently in custody and his identity will not be released until charges are formally laid . <p/>Police locked down the busy neighbourhood for almost three hours while they negotiated with the suspect , directing traffic away from Ontario Street . <p/>Employees at the party have been questioned by police and have been shuttled out by bus for further investigation . <p/>Police say they are receiving counseling from its Victim Services Unit . <p/>Employees at neighbouring businesses were forced to hide inside their offices during the shooting . <p/>The name of the deceased will not be released until next of kin are notified .

text: Fired Accountant Goes on Shooting Spree
arg1: Gordon Advisors PC receptionist Madeline Kafoury/Gordon Advisors PC partner Paul Riva/Gordon Advisors PC partner Alan Steinberg
marked_sentence: Fired Accountant Goes on <mark id="mark_id"> Shooting </mark> Spree
marked_doc: http : / / www . accountingweb . com / topic / watchdog / fired - accountant - goes - shooting - spree <p/>Fired Accountant Goes on <mark id="mark_id"> Shooting </mark> Spree <p/>on Apr 12 2007 <p/>A fired accountant bought a shotgun the day after he lost his job , then returned to the office the following week and opened fire on his bosses , wounding both and killing a receptionist , the Associated Press reported . <p/>Troy , Mich . police said Anthony LaCalamita III , 38 , targeted two managers and also may have intended to shoot another one . <p/>"There is a suspicion that there might have been a third upper management official he was seeking , " said Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck . <p/>The man , whom police did not identify , was not in the office at the time of the attack . <p/>LaCalamita had been fired last Thursday as a general accountant at the firm and bought a shotgun and shells on Friday , Scherlinck said . <p/>He said police found a box consistent with one that would hold a shotgun , as well as empty shell boxes , in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment Monday evening . <p/>When LaCalamita was arrested , police said they found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three shells in his vehicle . <p/>Scherlinck said LaCalamita had been denied a handgun permit in March but it wasn't clear why . <p/>Anthony LaCalamita III , 38 , had been arrested following a high - speed chase shortly after the Monday morning shootings at Gordon Advisors in suburban Detroit . <p/>During LaCalamita's arraignment , authorities described what witnesses saw inside the accounting firm's offices that morning . <p/>LaCalamita walked in around 10 a . m . , stopped briefly at the reception desk , then entered Alan Steinberg's office with the shotgun , Troy police Sgt . Barry Whiteside testified . <p/>Steinberg , a partner in the firm , later told police LaCalamita loaded a shell into the shotgun's chamber and fired at him , hitting him in the hip area . <p/>He then walked toward the office of Paul Riva , another partner . <p/>Receptionist Madeline Kafoury was standing in the doorway of Riva's office , and the gunman fatally shot her in the midsection , Whiteside said . <p/>LaCalamita shot Riva in the upper chest , then left the building , Whiteside said . <p/>He was gone when officers swarmed the office building and began evacuating other workers , then was arrested a few hours later after a chase on a nearby interstate . <p/>Riva had yet to regain consciousness Wednesday and was on a ventilator , police said . <p/>LaCalamita is charged with first - degree murder in the death of Kafoury , 63 , and intent to murder in the shootings of Riva , 47 , and Steinberg , 48 . <p/>He also is charged with possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and fleeing and eluding police . <p/>A not guilty plea was entered on LaCalamita's behalf during the hearing . <p/>Asked by the judge if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder , he responded "Yes . " <p/>The judge ordered him held without bail pending his next court hearing April 19 . <p/>The judge said he would appoint a lawyer for LaCalamita . <p/>He did not have a representative in court Wednesday . <p/>LaCalamita is married , but his wife , Michele , released a statement saying they had been separated for about three weeks . <p/>According to real estate records obtained by The Associated Press , the couple during the past year actively bought and sold suburban homes . <p/>Records list Michele LaCalamita as the owner of all four . <p/>Riva and Steinberg were being treated at Beaumont Hospital , where spokeswoman Ilene Wolff said the families of the wounded men asked that their conditions and other information not be released .

text: New York woman killed in hit - and - run crash
argL: Queens, New York City, New York, United States
marked_sentence: New York woman <mark id="mark_id"> killed </mark> in hit - and - run crash
marked_doc: http : / / www . injurylawofnewyork . com / blog / 2013 / 09 / new - york - woman - killed - in - hit - and - run - crash . shtml <p/>New York woman <mark id="mark_id"> killed </mark> in hit - and - run crash <p/>On behalf of Howard R . Sanders , Esq . posted in Pedestrian Accidents on Wednesday , September 18 , 2013 . <p/>According to investigators , a woman was killed by a hit - and - run driver in Queens on the night of Sept . 13 . <p/>At approximately 7 p . m . , the woman was walking near the intersection of 117th Street and 97th Avenue in Richmond Hill . <p/>She was walking among some parked cars when she was hit by a grey Toyota Camry that had been traveling north on 117th Street . <p/>The driver fled the accident scene but was apprehended by police officers . <p/>The driver was charged with DWI , leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death , criminally negligent homicide and vehicular manslaughter . <p/>A hit - and - run accident may be considered an example of extreme recklessness or carelessness on the part of a driver . <p/>A personal injury attorney might review a hit - and - run accident case and suggest seeking punitive damages . <p/>In some instances , it is possible to collect damages that exceed compensation for lost wages , medical expenses and funeral costs . <p/>The intention is to punish reckless and negligent drivers and also to send a message to other drivers . <p/>If the family wishes to seek only compensation for accident - related expenses , the attorney may negotiate for a settlement outside of court . <p/>On the other hand , if the family decides to seek punitive damages , the attorney might request a jury trial in civil court . <p/>If the at - fault driver was charged or convicted in criminal court , it may help support the claim of recklessness . <p/>The attorney may use police reports , photos and evidence to build a convincing argument on behalf of the family . <p/>If the judge and jury are persuaded by the argument and evidence presented , they may find in favor of the plaintiffs and award punitive damages .

text: A 59 - year - old woman was killed in a hit - and - run crash while visiting a former neighbor to welcome his new daughter - in - law to the family Friday evening , and the man allegedly behind the wheel of the car that hit her was charged with driving drunk , police and the woman ’ s friend said .
arg1: Raj Chohan's former neighbor's new daughter-in-law
argL: Queens, New York City, New York, United States
marked_sentence: A 59 - year - old woman was killed in a hit - and - run crash while visiting a former neighbor to <mark id="mark_id"> welcome </mark> his new daughter - in - law to the family Friday evening , and the man allegedly behind the wheel of the car that hit her was charged with driving drunk , police and the woman ’ s friend said .
marked_doc: http : / / www . timesledger . com / stories / 2013 / 38 / srichhillhitrun _ web _ 2013 _ 09 _ 14 _ q . html <p/>Man charged with DWI , leaving scene after S . Rich Hill mother killed in crash : NYPD <p/>A 59 - year - old woman was killed in a hit - and - run crash while visiting a former neighbor to <mark id="mark_id"> welcome </mark> his new daughter - in - law to the family Friday evening , and the man allegedly behind the wheel of the car that hit her was charged with driving drunk , police and the woman ’ s friend said . <p/>Raj K . Chohan was walking alongside parked cars on 117th Street and 97th Avenue at about 7 p . m . when she was struck by a gray 2013 Toyota Camry , which then sped off , according to cops . <p/>“ The husband and wife came to visit , ” said South Richmond Hill resident Suri Charanjit . <p/>“ He was with her when it happened . ” <p/>Charanjit said he and his family came out of their home on 117th Street and saw a crowd of people gathered and EMS performing CPR on Chohan . <p/>Emergency responders were called in and took Chohan to Jamaica Hospital , where she was later pronounced dead , the NYPD said . <p/>Residents along 117th Street said a police cruiser happened to be pulled over on the side of the road near where the crash occurred , and immediately chased the vehicle . <p/>Police said the officers caught up with 23 - year - old Vishwanand Subryan of Schenectady a few blocks away - at 115th Street and 101st Avenue - where he was taken into custody without incident . <p/>Subryan was charged with vehicular manslaughter , criminally negligent homicide , leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death and DWI , the NYPD said . <p/>Chohan , who is a mother to a married son and daughter , had been in her former neighborhood to visit Piara Singh , according to Charanjit who translated for Singh . <p/>She had moved about a mile and a half away five or six years ago , her friend said . <p/>As part of a Sikh tradition , she had been visiting to greet Singh ’ s daughter - in - law , who recently arrived from India , and present her with gifts , he explained . <p/>Chohan had called Singh ’ s house to let the family know she was outside and asked that someone open the door . <p/>“ When [ Singh ’ s ] son came out , he saw her on the floor , ” Charanjit said . <p/>Both Charanjit and Singh complained cars speeding along 117th Street . <p/>“ The cars come straight from 103rd Avenue . <p/>They have no stop sign , no bump , nothing but green until 95th Avenue , ” Charanjit said . <p/>“ This is just a side street . <p/>We want to have a stop sign . ”

marked_doc: http : / / www . ny1 . com / content / news / 188792 / woman - killed - in - queens - hit - and - run - - driver - charged <p/>Woman Killed In Queens Hit - And - Run , Driver Charged <p/>Updated 09 / 14 / 2013 01 : 03 PM <p/>A woman has died after being hit by a car that fled the scene in Queens , and now , the driver is facing manslaughter charges . <p/>Witnesses say 59 - year - old Raj Chohan was leaving her car on 117th Street in South Richmond Hill Friday when she was <mark id="mark_id"> hit </mark> by a silver Toyota Camry and sent flying into the air . <p/>She died at the hospital . <p/>Police caught up with the driver , who is from Schnectady , a few blocks away . <p/>He has been charged with vehicular manslaughter , negligent homicide and fleeing the scene of an accident .

text: Queens hit and run leaves woman dead
argL: Queens, New York City, New York, United States
marked_sentence: Queens <mark id="mark_id"> hit </mark> and run leaves woman dead
marked_doc: http : / / abclocal . go . com / wabc / story ? section=news / local / new _ york&id=9248033 <p/>Queens <mark id="mark_id"> hit </mark> and run leaves woman dead <p/>Saturday , September 14 , 2013 <p/>Police have a suspect in custody after a hit and run accident that killed a woman in Queens Friday night . <p/>Investigators say 59 - year old Raj Chohan was hit while walking along parked cars at 97th Avenue and 117th Street in Richmond Hill at about 7 p . m . <p/>Police say she was struck by a grey Toyota Camry heading north on 117th Street , which then fled the scene . <p/>They later apprehended the suspect , identified as 23 - year old Vishwanand Subryan of Schenectady , New York . <p/>He has been charged with Vehicular Manslaughter , Criminally Negligent Homicide , Leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death , and DWI . <p/>Eyewitness News has learned from people in the neighborhood that the victim is originally from Punjab , India . <p/>She was in the neighborhood visiting someone . <p/>She doesn't live on the block . <p/>Eyewitness News spoke to one man who says he called 911 after he heard a crash . <p/>"I see a person lying down . <p/>This is a mom , a female , and then I dialed 911 , " said Mahadeo Rambrich , a witness . <p/>"What did the person look like when you saw her lying on the ground ? " Eyewitness News asked . <p/>"Not responding . <p/>She was unconscious , " Rambrich said . <p/>This neighborhood is mostly made up of Indian and Guyanese families , and residents describe it as peaceful and quiet . <p/>There's a temple there . <p/>But Friday night , everyone was shaken up by what happened .

marked_doc: http : / / www . nydailynews . com / new - york / queens / hit - and - run - driver - kills - queens - granny - article - 1 . 1456300 <p/>Queens grandmother killed by a drunk hit - and - run driver <p/>Raj Chohan , 59 , was killed by a drunk hit - and - run driver as she was on her way to attend religious services on Friday . <p/>SATURDAY , SEPTEMBER 14 , 2013 , 9 : 29 PM <p/>A grandmother crossing a Queens street to <mark id="mark_id"> attend </mark> a religious service Friday was mowed down by a drunken hit - and - run driver , cops and family said . <p/>Raj Chohan , 59 , had just parked her car and was walking alongside other parked vehicles toward a Sikh temple when she was struck by a gray 2013 Toyota Camry heading north on 117th St . near 97th Ave . about 7 p . m . , police said . <p/>Chohan , who lived half a mile away in South Ozone Park , was rushed to Jamaica Hospital , where she later died . <p/>“ We are really just shocked , ” said her nephew , Ravi Singh , 32 , of Coney Island . <p/>“ She was so nice . <p/>She always takes care of everybody . ” <p/>A cop patrolling on foot happened to see the fleeing vehicle and alerted other officers , who pulled the heartless driver over at 115th St . and 101st Ave . <p/>Vishwanand Subryan , 23 , of Schenectady , N . Y . , was charged with vehicular manslaughter , criminally negligent homicide , driving drunk and leaving the scene of a fatal accident . <p/>“ He should be punished , in jail , for the rest of his life , ” Singh said . <p/>“ We were a very close family . ” <p/>Chohan , an Indian immigrant , lived with her husband , son and two grandkids . <p/>“ The grandkids were her whole life and joy , ” a family friend said . <p/>“ She was a very caring person . ”

Friday at 97th Avenue and 117th Street in Richmond Hill when she was hit by a 2013 Toyota Camry , which then fled , police told 1010 WINS ’ Glenn Schuck . <p/>A police officer that was parked nearby and witnessed the incident chased after the car and arrested Vishwanand Subryan , 23 , of Schenectady , several blocks away . <p/>Subryan is charged with DWI , vehicular manslaughter and leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death . <p/>Chohan was pronounced dead at Jamaica Hospital . <p/>Several neighbors ran outside to try to help the woman . <p/>“ Oh man , she was bad , ” one man told Schuck . <p/>“ There was nothing we could do . <p/>Everybody was just standing there all confused , like they can ’ t believe that this happened over here . <p/>She was out cold . ” <p/>“ My wife was getting ready to go out with the kid , and she screamed that somebody hit another car and ran away , ” another neighbor said . <p/>“ When I went to check , I saw the lady lying on the floor , but she wasn ’ t breathing or anything . ”

marked_doc: http : / / www . nbcnewyork . com / news / local / Richmond - Hill - Hit - Run - Woman - Critical - Condition - Queens - 223712941 . html <p/>Woman Killed in Queens Hit - Run , Driver Charged <p/>The woman was taken to Jamaica Hospital in traumatic arrest <p/>Saturday , Sep 14 , 2013 <p/>Police say a 59 - year - old woman died after being struck by a vehicle in Queens Friday night and that officers found and arrested the driver who <mark id="mark_id"> hit </mark> her a few blocks away . <p/>Raj Chohan was hit by a 2013 gray Camry near 117th Street and 97th Avenue in Richmond Hill . <p/>The victim's nephew said she had just gotten out of a car and was walking when the car "came out of nowhere" and hit her from behind . <p/>"Her forehead hit the back of the headlight , and the headlight broke , " said Manpreet Singh . <p/>"Everybody's in shock right now , " said Singh . <p/>The driver , who police identified as Vishwanand Subryan , fled the scene but was apprehended by police shortly afterward . <p/>Subryan , 23 , was charged with vehicular manslaughter , criminally negligent homicide , leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death and driving while intoxicated . <p/>Information on a lawyer for Subryan was not immediately available .

text: British climber dies in New Zealand fall
argL: Aoraki Mount Cook National Park, South Island, New Zealand
marked_sentence: British climber <mark id="mark_id"> dies </mark> in New Zealand fall
marked_doc: http : / / www . theguardian . com / world / 2013 / sep / 16 / british - climber - dies - new - zealand - buckley <p/>British climber <mark id="mark_id"> dies </mark> in New Zealand fall <p/>Robert Buckley the second climber to die in the Aoraki - Mount Cook national park at the weekend <p/>Monday 16 September 2013 03 . 31 BST <p/>A British climber has fallen to his death in New Zealand . <p/>Robert Buckley , 32 , fell about 2 , 000 feet while climbing to a small hut on Mount Sefton in the Aoraki - Mount Cook national park on Saturday , police said . <p/>Buckley , who had been living and working in Christchurch , was one of four men who were trying to climb to the Sefton Bivvy from Mount Cook Village , according to New Zealand media reports . <p/>They were within 80m of their destination when Buckley slipped . <p/>His companions raised the alarm , but then got stuck . <p/>A rescue helicopter found Buckley and the others but they could not be rescued until the next morning . <p/>Buckley's body was recovered later in the day . <p/>Police said in a statement it appeared the group was insufficiently equipped and experienced for the climb . <p/>The three other climbers were released after an examination by medical staff . <p/>The day before Buckley's death another climber , 36 - year - old Duncan Rait , died after slipping and falling about 200 feet from a ridge in the same national park . <p/>The New Zealand - born man , who lived in Australia , had been been dropped off by helicopter and was walking to a hut when he fell in the Tasman Glacier area . <p/>Police spokesman Dave Gaskin said the deaths were a reminder that climbers needed to use extreme caution . <p/>'I cant speak for the first death , but in this case it looks like to be a lack of experience , " Gaskin told the Timaru Herald . <p/>A Foreign Office spokeswoman said : "We are aware of the death of a British man in New Zealand . <p/>We are providing consular assistance at this time .

" <p/>Mr Buckley's death came a day after 36 - year - old Duncan Raite died when he slipped and fell around 200ft from a ridge in the same national park . <p/>The New Zealand - born man , who lived in Australia , had been dropped off by helicopter and was walking to a hut when he fell in the Tasman Glacier area . <p/>Mr Gaskin said the deaths were a reminder that climbers needed to use extreme caution . <p/>He said : "I can't speak for the first death , but in this case it looks like to be a lack of experience . " <p/>A Foreign Office spokeswoman said : "We are aware of the death of a British man in New Zealand . <p/>"We are providing consular assistance at this time . "

argL: Aoraki Mount Cook National Park, South Island, New Zealand

marked_doc: http : / / www . stuff . co . nz / national / 9167416 / Two - climbers - killed - in - Mt - Cook - falls <p/>Two climbers killed in Mt Cook falls <p/>Last updated 15 : 48 15 / 09 / 2013 <p/>The Aoraki Mt Cook Alpine Rescue Team have recovered the body of the second climber to fall to his death at Mount Cook National Park over the weekend . <p/>Inspector Dave Gaskin said the man fell around 2000ft ( 609 metres ) near the Mount Sefton Bivvy , above the Mueller Glacier . <p/>''The fall was unsurvivable , '' Inspector Gaskin said . <p/>There were four in the climbing party . <p/>The friends of the deceased had to stay in position overnight until the weather was suitable to carry them out by rescue helicopter this morning . <p/>The body was recovered in the afternoon , and taken to Mt Cook Village initially , then on to Timaru . <p/>Inspector Gaskin confirmed the climbing party are foreigners , but would not specify any other details until the family of the deceased had been informed . <p/>With two deaths at Mt Cook National Park this weekend , Inspector Gaskin said police and rescures were pushed to their limits <p/>''Resources are tight , there's no doubt about that . <p/>It's been very difficult but the guys have done a wonderful job . " <p/>The rescue team had to carry the man by stretcher down a glacier , walking two hours to reach a rescue helicopter . <p/>A Westpac Rescue Helicopter from Christchurch was called to help with search and rescue co - ordination at the Mt Cook base . <p/>By the time it arrived , the man had been transported to Mt Cook Village by a local helicopter service and had been pronounced dead by paramedics . <p/>He had been planning a four - day ski tour of the area and was using the Tasman Saddle Hut as a base , police said . <p/>Mr Campbell said police told him the man was well - equipped but was not wearing crampons when he slipped . <p/>A massive rescue bid was made shortly after 11am on Friday , with members of the Aoraki Mt Cook Department of Conservation Alpine Rescue Team , Alpine Guides , The Helicopter Line , Twizel and Fairlie police and Westpac Rescue paramedics all called in to help . <p/>Constable Joseph Rush , of Twizel police , said the weather conditions were severe , with poor visibility , strong wind gusts and - 15C temperatures . <p/>The man's name will not be released until family have been notified .

marked_doc: http : / / www . deadline . com / 2013 / 08 / ellen - degeneres - to - host - oscars / <p/>Ellen DeGeneres To <mark id="mark_id"> Host </mark> 86th Oscars <p/>Friday August 2 , 2013 @ 8 : 13am PDT <p/>Ellen DeGeneres just tweeted she will be hosting the Oscars this year . <p/>It will be her second stint in the job , after hosting the 2007 ceremony and earning an Emmy nomination for it . <p/>“ It ’ s official : I ’ m hosting the #Oscars ! <p/>I ’ d like to thank @TheAcademy , my wife Portia and , oh dear , there goes the orchestra “ , the comedian and talk show host said on her Twitter feed just now . <p/>The announcement of DeGeneres as host comes just a couple of days after the election of Cheryl Boone Isaacs , only the third woman to head the Academy in its 86 - hosting stint in the now - defunct category of Outstanding Individual Performance in a Variety or Music Program . <p/>She also famously hosted the Emmys in November 2001 after the show was canceled twice in the wake of the 9 / 11 tragedy . <p/>She returned to host the Emmys in 2005 , just three weeks after Hurricane Katrina . <p/>She also hosted the Grammys in 1996 and 1997 . <p/>Here ’ s the Academy ’ s official release : <p/>Television icon Ellen DeGeneres will return to host the Oscars® for a second time , producers Craig Zadan and Neil Meron announced today . <p/>The Academy Awards® will be broadcast live on Oscar Sunday , March 2 , 2014 , on the ABC Television Network . <p/>“ We are thrilled to have Ellen DeGeneres host the Oscars , ” said Zadan and Meron . <p/>She is beloved everywhere and we expect that the audience at the Dolby Theatre , and in homes around the globe , will be as excited by this news as we are . ” <p/>“ I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time . <p/>You know what they say – the third time ’ s the charm , ” said DeGeneres . <p/>“ It is an honor to welcome back Ellen DeGeneres as the host of the biggest entertainment celebration of the year , ” said Paul Lee , president , ABC Entertainment Group . <p/>DeGeneres hosted the 79th Academy Awards in 2007 , for which she received a Primetime Emmy® nomination for “ Outstanding Individual Performance in a Variety or Music Program . ”
