text: Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will make her second appearance as an Academy Awards host next year , organizers said on Friday , in a move widely seen as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane .
marked_sentence: Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will make her second appearance as an Academy Awards host next year , organizers said on Friday , in a move widely <mark id="mark_id"> seen </mark> as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane .
marked_doc: http : / / www . reuters . com / article / 2013 / 08 / 02 / us - oscars - degeneres - idUSBRE9710UQ20130802 <p/>Comedian Ellen DeGeneres picked to host 2014 Oscars <p/>Fri Aug 2 , 2013 6 : 50pm EDT <p/>Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will make her second appearance as an Academy Awards host next year , organizers said on Friday , in a move widely <mark id="mark_id"> seen </mark> as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane . <p/>DeGeneres , the star of her own daytime talk show "Ellen , " first hosted the Oscars in 2007 , becoming only the second woman to fill that exalted role alone , after Whoopi Goldberg . <p/>"I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time , " DeGeneres said in a statement . <p/>"You know what they say - the third time's the charm . " <p/>"I'd like to thank @TheAcademy , my wife Portia and , oh dear , there goes the orchestra , " the comedian added on Twitter . <p/>DeGeneres , 55 , earned an Emmy nomination for her performance in 2007 in which she departed from traditional Oscar hosting decorum and ventured into the audience for spot gags , at one point handing director Martin Scorsese a script of her own . <p/>"Choosing DeGeneres , known for her kindler , gentler humor , signals that the Academy's next awards show will have a decidedly different tone than the 85th Academy Awards , " trade magazine The Hollywood Reporter wrote . <p/>DeGeneres also earned praise for her performance as the host of TV's Emmy awards in 2001 , which was twice delayed because of the September 11 attacks , memorably lightening the somber mood by asking , "What would bug the Taliban more than seeing a gay woman in a suit surrounded by Jews ? " <p/>The announcement of DeGeneres as host also comes on the heels of Hollywood marketing executive Cheryl Boone Isaacs being elected as the first African American president of the 6 , 000 - member Academy , which has made an effort to diversify its ranks after coming under fire for being too male , old and white . <p/>Trade publication Variety saw the choice of DeGeneres as a continuation of the Academy's "Year of the Woman , " writing that the Oscars "will put women in the driver's seat . "

marked_doc: http : / / www . theguardian . com / film / 2013 / aug / 02 / ellen - degeneres - host - oscars - 2014 <p/>Ellen DeGeneres to host Oscars in 2014 <p/><mark id="mark_id"> This </mark> will be second time hosting for the daytime talkshow star who will follow on from Seth MacFarlane's savaged 2013 stint <p/>The comedian Ellen DeGeneres announced on Friday that she is to return as host of the Academy Awards , the second time she has been tasked with saving the Oscars a year after a poorly received performer . <p/>For the 2014 show , she follows a heavily criticised performance this year by the Family Guy creator Seth MacFarlane . <p/>In 2007 , she put the Oscars back on an even keel after poor reviews for the satirist Jon Stewart in 2006 . <p/>"I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time . <p/>You know what they say – the third time's the charm , " DeGeneres said in a statement . <p/>She is a safe bet for the Academy , following an outraged reaction to the misogynistic jokes that peppered MacFarlane's script . <p/>While MacFarlane's performance generated high ratings for the broadcast – 40 . 3 million people watched , 2% higher than the year before – he said he would not host the Oscars again because of the negative response . <p/>DeGeneres however , has a history of well - received hosting gigs . <p/>She was nominated for a Primetime Emmy for her performance as Oscars host in 2007 . <p/>She also garnered positive responses as a two - time Emmy Awards host , carrying the ceremony shortly after 9 / 11 and then after Hurricane Katrina . <p/>Her previous Oscar gig , in which Martin Scorsese's The Departed took home the top prize , was watched by 39 . 9 million people . <p/>DeGeneres made the announcement on Twitter on Friday and said : "It's official : I'm hosting the #Oscars ! <p/>I'd like to thank @TheAcademy , my wife Portia and , oh dear , there goes the orchestra . text: On July 13 , Obama announced that he was nominating Regina M . Benjamin , MD , a family physician from southern Alabama , to be surgeon general .
marked_sentence: On July 13 , Obama announced that he was <mark id="mark_id"> nominating </mark> Regina M . Benjamin , MD , a family physician from southern Alabama , to be surgeon general .
marked_doc: http : / / www . amednews . com / article / 20090720 / government / 307209986 / 1 / <p/>Former AMA trustee Dr . Benjamin nominated to be surgeon general <p/>Posted July 20 , 2009 <p/>President Obama's choices to be the nation's top physician and top scientist are both hands - on practitioners with extensive leadership experience . <p/>On July 13 , Obama announced that he was <mark id="mark_id"> nominating </mark> Regina M . Benjamin , MD , a family physician from southern Alabama , to be surgeon general . <p/>Dr . Benjamin , 52 , became the first woman and first African - American president of the Medical Assn . of the State of Alabama in 2002 . <p/>She also completed a term in June as chair of the AMA Council on Ethical and Judicial Affairs and served on the AMA Board of Trustees from 1995 to 1998 , becoming the first physician under 40 to serve on the board in a non - resident role . <p/>On July 8 , Obama nominated Francis S . Collins , MD , PhD , as director of the National Institutes of Health . <p/>Dr . Collins , 59 , led the Human Genome Project - - an effort to sequence and map human genes , that concluded in 2003 . <p/>He left his position as director of the NIH's National Human Genome Research Institute in 2008 after 15 years but maintains a lab at the NIH's Bethesda , Md . , campus . <p/>Both nominees must first be confirmed by the Senate . <p/>AMA President J . James Rohack , MD , said Dr . Benjamin has an impressive list of accomplishments , including receiving a MacArthur Fellowship in 2008 , commonly known as the "genius grant . " <p/>But awards are not her main focus , he said . <p/>"Dr . Benjamin's most important qualification for surgeon general is her deep commitment to her patients . " <p/>Dr . Benjamin said in the White House Rose Garden announcement that the deaths of close relatives from preventable diseases drove her to focus on public health . <p/>"My father died with diabetes and hypertension . <p/>My older brother , and only sibling , died at age 44 of HIV - related illness . <p/>My mother died of lung cancer , because as a young girl , she wanted to smoke just like her twin brother could . " <p/>Dr . Collins' colleagues said he is a natural choice to head the primary federal agency for funding and conducting medical research because of his thoughtfulness , willingness to listen and experience as a spokesman for the genome mapping effort . <p/>"He's a forceful personality , " said Tom Murray , PhD , head of the Hastings Center , an independent bioethics research institute . <p/>"He wants to hear from people who don't agree with him . " <p/>Patients before profits <p/>If confirmed , Dr . Benjamin would be the nation's lead public health educator . <p/>Fellow physicians see the role as a good fit . <p/>Besides experience with family illnesses , Dr . Benjamin said she also was influenced by her medical school training under David Satcher , MD , PhD , who later became surgeon general , and others who focused on public health issues in underserved areas . <p/>Jorge Alsip , MD , the Alabama medical society's president , said Dr . Benjamin has seen how much patients in poor and rural areas appreciate her help . <p/>"That can't help but affect you and make you want to do something for these people , " said Dr . Alsip , an emergency physician who has known Dr . Benjamin for more than 15 years . <p/>Dr . Alsip also said Dr . Benjamin is tenacious . <p/>"If Regina's in a fight , don't ever bet against her . " <p/>She rebuilt her clinic in Bayou La Batre , Ala . , twice after hurricanes destroyed it and is rebuilding it a third time after a fire . <p/>Obama said his surgeon general pick has personally witnessed how the U . S . health system is broken . <p/>"She's seen an increasing number of patients who've had health insurance their entire lives suddenly lose it because they lost their jobs or because it's simply become too expensive . " <p/>Dr . Benjamin lamented the difficulty some doctors face in caring for patients , regardless of ability to pay . <p/>"It shouldn't be this expensive for Americans to get health care in this country , " she said . <p/>Obama said Dr . Benjamin has forgone a salary when her clinic faced financial hardship . <p/>Jeff Terry , MD , chair of the AMA's Alabama delegation and a urologist , said Dr . Benjamin has proven herself through work in organized medicine and elsewhere . <p/>The two co - founded the young physicians section of the state medical society nearly two decades ago . <p/>Since then , she has held leadership positions in physician organizations and other groups . <p/>Dr . Benjamin is also probably more politically liberal than many physicians on Alabama's Gulf Coast , Dr . Terry said . <p/>"Maybe President Obama saw a little of that in her . " <p/>Both scientific and religious <p/>Obama lauded Dr . Collins' experience in the July 8 announcement . <p/>"Dr . Collins is one of the top scientists in the world , and his groundbreaking work has changed the very ways we consider our health and examine disease . " <p/>Dr . Collins' laboratory discovered several important genes , including those responsible for cystic fibrosis and Huntington's disease . <p/>Acquaintances and colleagues predicted that Dr . Collins would do a good job representing NIH in front of lawmakers and others . <p/>He is a very approachable person who doesn't rely on jargon to communicate , said Sean B . Tipton , spokesman for the American Society of Reproductive Medicine . <p/>"He has an ability to interact with the public and with policymakers and the press that I think will serve him very well as an NIH director . " <p/>The Hastings Center's Murray said that if Dr . Collins ever made a mistake , it may be that he was a bit overly enthusiastic when describing the potential for breakthroughs when he was leading the Human Genome Project . <p/>Still , "I can't fault the scientist who really believes in their work for being enthusiastic as they talk to Congress , " Murray said . <p/>Dr . Collins has garnered attention by professing that his belief in God can coexist with his pursuit of science . <p/>He's written books on the topic , including the 2007 best - seller The Language of God : A Scientist Presents Evidence for Belief . <p/>He is also founder and president of the BioLogos Foundation , whose purpose is to find compatibility between the scientific and religious searches for truth . <p/>In an interview with the spiritual Web site Beliefnet in 2007 , Dr . Collins said Christians who reject scientific evolutionary theory are also rejecting humans' ability to understand , a God - given skill . <p/>But there are limits to the questions science can answer , such as why we are here or what happens after death , he said . <p/>William Hurlbut , MD , a consulting professor of neuroscience at Stanford University and a former member of President George W . Bush's Council on Bioethics , said the idea that science and religion can't coexist is ridiculous . <p/>"A person with Francis' background is a very wise choice" for NIH chief , he said .

text: Dr . Regina Benjamin : Nominee for Surgeon General
marked_sentence: Dr . Regina Benjamin : <mark id="mark_id"> Nominee </mark> for Surgeon General
marked_doc: http : / / www . whitehouse . gov / blog / Dr - Regina - Benjamin - Nominee - for - Surgeon - General <p/>Dr . Regina Benjamin : <mark id="mark_id"> Nominee </mark> for Surgeon General <p/>July 13 , 2009 12 : 49 PM EDT <p/>The President announced his nominee for the U . S . Surgeon General , Dr . Regina Benjamin , today at the White House . <p/>Dr . Benjamin has an extensive and distinguished career in medicine . <p/>She is the Founder and CEO of the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic in Alabama , which aims to provide primary care to people of any age regardless of their financial situation . <p/>She previously served as Chair of the Federation of State Medical Boards of the United States , and as the Associate Dean for Rural Health at the University of South Alabama College of Medicine . <p/>Additionally , she was chosen as President of the Medical Association of Alabama in 2002 , becoming the first African - American woman to be president of a state medical society . <p/>She was also the first African - American woman and physician under 40 to be elected to the American Medical Association Board of Trustees . <p/>She received the Nelson Mandela Award for Health and Human Rights in 1998 , among other honors . <p/>The President emphasized this experience in his remarks , chronicling her dedication to providing health care for her rural community in the face of adversity : <p/>And that's why , even though she could have left the state to make more money as a specialist or as a doctor in a wealthier community , Regina Benjamin returned to Alabama and opened a small clinic in Bayou La Batre . <p/>When people couldn't pay , she didn't charge them . <p/>When the clinic wasn't making money , she didn't take a salary for herself . <p/>When Hurricane George destroyed the clinic in 1998 , she made house calls to all her patients while it was rebuilt . <p/>When Hurricane Katrina destroyed it again and left most of her town homeless , she mortgaged her house and maxed out her credit cards to rebuild that clinic for a second time . <p/>She tended to those who had been wounded in the storm , and when folks needed medicine , she asked the pharmacist to send the bill her way . <p/>And when Regina's clinic was about to open for the third time , and a fire burned it to the ground before it could serve the first patient , well , you can guess what Dr . Benjamin did . <p/>With help from her community , she is rebuilding it again . <p/>One disabled patient brought her an envelope with $20 inside . <p/>Another elderly man said simply , "Maybe I can help . <p/>I got a hammer . " <p/>For nearly two decades , Dr . Regina Benjamin has seen in a very personal way what is broken about our health care system . <p/>She's seen an increasing number of patients who've had health insurance their entire lives suddenly lose it because they lost their jobs or because it's simply become too expensive . <p/>She's been a relentless promoter of prevention and wellness programs , having treated too many costly and - - diseases and complications that didn't have to happen . <p/>And she's witnessed the shortage of primary care physicians in the rural and underserved areas where she works . <p/>But for all that she's seen and all the tremendous obstacles that she has overcome , Regina Benjamin also represents what's best about health care in America - - doctors and nurses who give and care and sacrifice for the sake of their patients ; those Americans who would do anything to heal a fellow citizen . <p/>As the President explained , through this personal experience working with the poor and uninsured , Dr . Benjamin understands firsthand the urgent need for health care reform . <p/>As Surgeon General , she will be the people's health advocate , and will play a key role in health care reform . <p/>In her remarks , Dr . Benjamin explained how she sees her role : <p/>My hope , if confirmed as Surgeon General , is to be America's doctor , America's family physician . <p/>As we work toward a solution to this health care crisis , I promise to communicate directly with the American people to help guide them through whatever changes may come with health care reform .

text: President Obama will name Dr . Regina Benjamin as U . S . Surgeon General in a Rose Garden announcement late this morning .
marked_sentence: President Obama will <mark id="mark_id"> name </mark> Dr . Regina Benjamin as U . S . Surgeon General in a Rose Garden announcement late this morning .
marked_doc: http : / / abcnews . go . com / blogs / politics / 2009 / 07 / the - doctor - is - finally - in - obama - to - name - regina - benjamin - for - surgeon - general / <p/>The Doctor Is ( Finally ) In : Obama To Nominate Regina Benjamin as Surgeon General <p/>Jul 13 , 2009 11 : 23am <p/>President Obama will <mark id="mark_id"> name </mark> Dr . Regina Benjamin as U . S . Surgeon General in a Rose Garden announcement late this morning . <p/>Benjamin , an Alabama family physician , runs a rural health clinic in Bayou La Batre . <p/>She was the first African - American woman to head a state medical society and received a MacArthur Foundation "genius grant" last year . <p/>She became known nationally for her determination to rebuild her clinic , destroyed in Hurricane Katrina in 2005 . <p/>In her profile on the National Institutes of Health web site , Benjamin writes about her calling to become a doctor while in medical school at the University of Alabama at Birmingham . <p/>"I believe it was divine intervention - it was in medical school when I realized there was nothing else I'd rather do with my life than to be a doctor . <p/>I had never seen a black doctor before I went to college , so I did not have an idea that I wanted to be one . <p/>I never thought I that I couldn't , but I never really thought about it at all . " <p/>According to a 1997 article in Ebony , Benjamin said she applied to Yale University School of Law before she attended college . <p/>"They sent me a reply politely telling me that I needed my undergraduate degree first . " <p/>To pay for college , she turned to the National Health Service Corps , which gave her a tuition reimbursement in exchange for committing to work in areas where there was a shortage of doctors . <p/>That agreement took her to Bayou La Batre where she was the only doctor for 2 , 500 people , most of whom lived below the poverty line and spoke no English . <p/>Benjamin was named the Person of the Week on ABC News' World News Tonight in 1995 and conveyed the challenges of servicing poor patients . <p/>"The people are real , genuine , hardworking . <p/>They're proud people . <p/>They make a living the best they can on shrimp boats . <p/>They , unfortunately , are too poor to pay their medical bills at times , " she told ABC News' Peter Jennings . <p/>"Sometimes it's very frustrating . <p/>Sometimes I can do everything that the textbooks taught me and school taught me and then patients can't buy their medicine . <p/>And it's all for nothing . " <p/>In January , it was reported that President Obama had asked CNN's Dr . Sanjay Gupta to be Surgeon General , and that Gupta had mulled the offer for a while , but eventually turned it down . <p/>Benjamin will appear in the Rose Garden today as the president makes the nomination formal .

text: AMA Celebrates Nomination of Regina Benjamin , MD , Surgeon General

marked_doc: http : / / www . ama - assn . org / ama / pub / news / news / regina - benjamin - surgeon - general . page <p/>AMA Celebrates <mark id="mark_id"> Nomination </mark> of Regina Benjamin , MD , Surgeon General <p/>For immediate release : <p/>July 13 , 2009 <p/>The American Medical Association is delighted that Dr . Regina Benjamin , MD , has been nominated to serve as our nation's next U . S . Surgeon General . <p/>Her many impressive accomplishments , including receiving a 2008 MacArthur Fellowship , commonly known as the "genius grant" , leave no doubt as to her qualifications . <p/>"Dr . Benjamin's most important qualification for surgeon general is her deep commitment to her patients . <p/>We are particularly gratified to see her recognized for her work caring for patients in rural Alabama , and for her commitment to rebuilding her rural health clinic in the wake of Hurricane Katrina . <p/>She is a true professional who puts her patients first . <p/>The AMA is immensely proud of Dr . Benjamin's accomplishments , and we are extremely fortunate that she has just served a term as chair of the AMA's Council on Ethical and Judicial Affairs . <p/>She served as a member of the AMA's Board of Trustees with the dual distinctions of being the AMA's first young physician trustee , as well as the first African - American woman board member . <p/>We look forward to seeing Dr . Benjamin serve as an advocate for all the nation's patients , as our country works toward health reform that provides high quality , affordable health coverage for all . "

text: President Nominates Regina Benjamin , MD to Serve as Surgeon General
marked_sentence: President <mark id="mark_id"> Nominates </mark> Regina Benjamin , MD to Serve as Surgeon General
marked_doc: http : / / www . nlm . nih . gov / news / benjamin _ surg _ gen . html <p/>President <mark id="mark_id"> Nominates </mark> Regina Benjamin , MD to Serve as Surgeon General <p/>Rural Family Physician Featured in NLM's "Changing the Face of Medicine" Exhibition <p/>President Obama has nominated Alabama physician Dr . Regina Benjamin to be US Surgeon General . <p/>Dr . Benjamin is one of the outstanding American women physicians profiled in NLM's 2003 - 2005 exhibition , "Changing the Face of Medicine . " <p/>Her biography appears at : http : / / www . nlm . nih . gov / changingthefaceofmedicine / physicians / biography _ 31 . html . <p/>With support from the American Library Association , "Changing the Face of Medicine" is traveling the nation through November 2010 . <p/>You can view the itinerary at : http : / / www . nlm . nih . gov / hmd / about / exhibition / travelingexhibitions / ctfom . html . <p/>Dr . Benjamin , who has held leadership positions statewide and nationally , has long provided medical care on the Gulf Coast . <p/>In 1990 , she founded Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic in the fishing village of Bayou La Batre , Alabama . <p/>Her clinic was battered by Hurricane Georges in 1998 and Hurricane Katrina in 2005 , but Benjamin rebuilt it each time and continued to offer medical care to the village's 2 , 500 residents . <p/>Many of her family practice patients are uninsured , according to the MacArthur Foundation , which last year awarded her one of its prestigious $500 , 000 "genius" grants . <p/>Her patient population includes immigrants from Vietnam , Cambodia and Laos , who comprise a third of Bayou La Batre's population . <p/>Benjamin received a bachelor's degree in 1979 from Xavier University of Louisiana , attended Morehouse School of Medicine from 1980 to 1982 and received a doctor of medicine degree from the University of Alabama at Birmingham in 1984 . <p/>She completed her residency in family practice at the Medical Center of Central Georgia in 1987 and has served as CEO of the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic since its founding in 1990 . <p/>She earned a master's degree in business administration in 1991 from Tulane University . <p/>Dr . Benjamin also served as the associate dean for rural health at the University of South Alabama's College of Medicine and as president of the State of Alabama Medical Association from 2002 to 2003 . <p/>She is the first woman , first African American woman and first person under age 40 to sit on the board of trustees of the American Medical Association , serving from 1995 through 1998 . <p/>The U . S . Surgeon General serves as America's chief health educator by providing Americans the best scientific information available on how to improve their health and reduce the risk of illness and injury . <p/>In carrying out all responsibilities , the Surgeon General reports to the Assistant Secretary for Health , who is the principal advisor to the Secretary of Health and Human Services on public health and scientific issues . <p/>The US Surgeon General also serves on the NLM Board of Regents as an ex officio member .

text: Surgeon General Nominee Dr . Regina Benjamin
marked_sentence: Surgeon General <mark id="mark_id"> Nominee </mark> Dr . Regina Benjamin
marked_doc: http : / / www . womenmakingmoves . org / 2009 / 07 / surgeon - general - nominee - dr - regina . html <p/>WEDNESDAY , JULY 29 , 2009 <p/>Surgeon General <mark id="mark_id"> Nominee </mark> Dr . Regina Benjamin <p/>I was immediately impressed with Dr . Regina Benjamin's background when President Obama nominated her for U . S . Surgeon General . <p/>She's led an impressive career , one that includes deciding to practice in a low - income community in the Gulf Coast of Alabama . <p/>The Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic has been a staple for residents since 1987 and often doesn't charge patients who can't afford to pay . <p/>The clinic also focuses heavily on preventative illness since this hits close to home for Dr . Benjamin . <p/>She lost her father to diabetics and high - blood pressure , her mother to lung cancer and her brother from a HIV - related illness . <p/>Personally and professionally , Dr . Benjamin has longed fought for the well - being of others . <p/>After researching her background , I had a gut feeling she was a member of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority , Inc . , a non - profit community service based organization . <p/>And it was confirmed several days later when the sorority's national president announced Dr . Benjamin became a member while completing her undergraduate degree at Xavier University in New Orleans , La . <p/>While I wasn't the only one impressed with Dr . Benjamin's background , there were also some who questioned her ability to perform the duties of Surgeon General . <p/>An article with the subtitle : "Do you have to be thin to be fit for the role of nation's Top Doc ? " , was published shortly after Dr . Benjamin's nomination . <p/>Dr . Arthur Caplan penned the article and defended Dr . Benjamin due to her tireless effort of serving those less fortunate . <p/>I applaud him for taking a stand on Dr . Benjamin's behalf . <p/>I don't condone a unhealthy lifestyle , but I'm sure Dr . Benjamin is probably like many of us . <p/>With hectic work schedules and families , it can be difficult to find time to lead a healthy lifestyle . <p/>I struggle with juggling my to - do - list daily and sometimes exercise and healthy eating doesn't make the cut . <p/>It's no secret that women are confronted with these issues more than men . <p/>I'm calling on women to speak up for Dr . Benjamin . <p/>You don't have to agree with the policies of President Obama or even with the nomination of Dr . Benjamin , but we can't continue to allow society to dictate our outer appearance . <p/>Women , start making your Moves today !

text: In a Monday statement President Obama said he intended to nominate Dr . Regina Benjamin as Surgeon General , the United States government's "chief health educator . "
marked_sentence: In a Monday statement President Obama <mark id="mark_id"> said </mark> he intended to nominate Dr . Regina Benjamin as Surgeon General , the United States government's "chief health educator . "
marked_doc: http : / / www . catholicnewsagency . com / news / obama _ nominates _ rural _ catholic _ doctor _ as _ surgeon _ general / <p/>Obama nominates rural Catholic doctor as Surgeon General <p/>Washington D . C . , Jul 13 , 2009 / 02 : 00 pm ( CNA ) <p/>President Barack Obama has announced that he is nominating a rural Alabama Catholic doctor to be the U . S . Surgeon General . <p/>Reacting to the news , the rector of Mobile's Catholic cathedral , where she serves as lector , is encouraging her to defend the unborn in her new position . <p/>In a Monday statement President Obama <mark id="mark_id"> said </mark> he intended to nominate Dr . Regina Benjamin as Surgeon General , the United States government's "chief health educator . " <p/>The president's announcement focused on health care reform as an urgent challenge . <p/>Dr . Benjamin , the first black woman to be admitted to the American Medical Association , founded the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic in Alabama in 1990 . <p/>There , she served the poor Alabama community on the Gulf Coast after 1998's Hurricane Georges and 2005's Hurricane Katrina . <p/>She had to rebuild the clinic after it burned down , receiving a $500 , 000 MacArthur Foundation "genius grant" in 2008 for the effort . <p/>Dr . Benjamin is known as being a national leader in improving health disparities , motivated by the need in her community . <p/>Immigrants from Vietnam , Cambodia and Laos make up a third of the area's population of 2 , 500 . <p/>She received the Nelson Mandela Award for Health and Human Rights in 1998 . <p/>Pope Benedict XVI awarded her the Pro Ecclessia et Pontifice medal in 2006 . <p/>President Obama's announcement also noted that Dr . Benjamin received the 2000 National Caring Award which was inspired by Mother Teresa . <p/>The nominee graduated from Xavier University in New Orleans , a Catholic school descended from the educational work of St . Katharine Drexel . <p/>Dr . Benjamin received her medical degree from the University of Alabama , Birmingham . <p/>Dr . Benjamin has also served on the Board of Trustees for the Catholic Health Association , a position that she will resign from to take on her new job . <p/>In a Monday statement , CHA president and chief executive officer Sister Carol Keehan , DC , said that the organization "rejoices for our nation" in Dr . Benjamin's nomination . <p/>"In Dr . Benjamin , we have a brilliant physician who understands health care , nationally and internationally ; but even more important , she knows the health care needs of the people of Bayou La Batre , Alabama , who she meets on a daily basis . " <p/>Sr . Keehan said the nominee will "enrich the nation" with her competence and integrity and she praised Dr . Benjamin's daily experience working in "a very vulnerable committee . " <p/>CNA spoke with Msgr . Michael L . Farmer , Vicar General of the Archdiocese of Mobile and rector at the Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception in Mobile . <p/>Msgr . Farmer said Dr . Benjamin is a "delightful lady" who has served as lector at the cathedral and has been "readily available" to speak with various Catholic organizations . <p/>She has also worked with Catholic Charities in Mobile and has spoken on the good the organization does . <p/>He reported that she grew up at the historically African - American parish Shrine of the Holy Cross in the Gulf Coast town of Daphne , Alabama . <p/>The monsignor also confirmed that then - Archbishop of Mobile Oscar Lipscomb recommended Dr . Regina Benjamin for the Pro Ecclesia et Pontifice award . <p/>The medal is bestowed to lay people and clergy who have given zealous and outstanding service to the Church . <p/>The honor was instituted by Pope Leo XIII in 1888 . <p/>"He recommended her for her example in her Catholic faith as well as in her medical profession , " Msgr . Farmer said , noting the "amazing amount of work" she has done for the common good and for health care in south Mobile County . <p/>Expressing certainty that Dr . Benjamin had opportunities to go elsewhere , he said the doctor had made a "concrete decision" to remain in Alabama and address her patients' needs . <p/>"She's noted not only for clinic work , but for going on site to these people's homes . <p/>And they're not necessarily the nicest places to go to . " <p/>He said it was "remarkable" and "bridge - building" that Dr . Benjamin , an African - American woman , has done her work in the bayou , which he described as a majority white community with "a lot of poor people in it . " <p/>Given the appointments and policy decisions of the Obama Administration that favor the promotion of abortion , CNA asked Msgr . Farmer if he knew what Dr . Benjamin's position is on abortion . <p/>He explained that he did not "explicitly" know Dr . Benjamin's position on abortion and other life issues and had never discussed it with her . <p/>"I would hope that her position would be in line with the Church's position , " he told CNA . <p/>"As far as I know she has been in conformity with the Catholic Church . " <p/>"I would hope that that would continue , " he added , noting that it could be "difficult" to adhere to Catholic moral teaching in a position with the Obama Administration . <p/>In a Monday morning telephone interview with CNA , Sr . Keehan pointed out that Dr . Benjamin isn't "in a specialty that would do abortion" and that her work to provide health care to the poor and elderly demonstrates her "tremendous attention to the issue of life . " <p/>"And you've got her own archbishop who asked the Holy Father to give her the Pro Ecclesia medal . <p/>"You don't get that for just being a token Catholic , " she told CNA . <p/>In December 2008 a coalition of several dozen pro - abortion groups released a strategy document titled "Advancing Reproductive Rights and Health in a New Administration" calling on Obama to improve access to "abortion care . " <p/>The document named the surgeon general's office as a "position of interest . "

text: But after being arrested for suspicion DUI earlier this week , he has bigger worries than his role in the Chargers ' offense .
marked_sentence: But after being <mark id="mark_id"> arrested </mark> for suspicion DUI earlier this week , he has bigger worries than his role in the Chargers ' offense .
marked_doc: Chargers ' Jackson arrested on suspicion of DUI <p/>But after being <mark id="mark_id"> arrested </mark> for suspicion DUI earlier this week , he has bigger worries than his role in the Chargers ' offense . <p/>10News in San Diego is reporting that Jackson was arrested by the California Highway Patrol early Tuesday morning after failing sobriety tests . <p/>CHP Officer Brad Baehr said Jackson was on probation for a previous DUI arrest . <p/>The Chargers will not discipline Jackson at this time , but it 's almost a guarantee that the NFL will step in and suspend him for several games at the start of this season . <p/>However , unless you hear otherwise , Jackson will be playing in this week 's divisional playoff at Pittsburgh . <p/>Those in postseason leagues ( like our SalCap game or our 3-for-All game ) should avoid Jackson , but not just because of his recent troubles with the law . <p/>He was held without a catch for the second time all year last week , and this week he faces Pittsburgh 's top-ranked pass defense ( 156.9 yards allowed per game ) . <p/>In San Diego 's first meeting with the Steelers this season , Jackson was held to just two catches for 25 yards . <p/>Jackson 's recent run-in with the law effectively puts an end to his keeper value for next season .

marked_doc: http : / / tucsoncitizen . com / morgue / 2009 / 02 / 04 / 109301 - san - diego - lineman - arrested - on - suspicion - of - dui / <p/>San Diego lineman <mark id="mark_id"> arrested </mark> on suspicion of DUI <p/>on Feb . 04 , 2009 <p/>San Diego Chargers defensive tackle Jamal Williams was arrested on suspicion of drunken driving , the team ’ s second such arrest in less than a month . <p/>Williams was pulled over for speeding early Sunday on a freeway outside downtown San Diego , the California Highway Patrol said . <p/>Williams gave a blood sample for a blood - alcohol test , but the results were not yet known . <p/>Williams was booked into county jail and later released on bail . <p/>The City Attorney ’ s office said the case hadn ’ t been submitted as of Tuesday . <p/>“ It ’ s disappointing to hear about the issue involving Jamal Williams , ” general manager A . J . Smith said in a statement released by the team . <p/>“ We ’ ll continue to monitor the situation and let the legal process run its course . <p/>“ The Chargers have always been leaders and positive contributors to our community , ” Smith added . <p/>“ We take our stature in the community very seriously . <p/>Through the Chargers and the NFL , our players receive one of the most comprehensive education and support programs in sports to help them deal with issues that affect all segments of society . ” <p/>Smith didn ’ t return a call seeking further comment . <p/>Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson was arrested for investigation of DUI on Jan . 6 , five days before San Diego ’ s playoff loss at Pittsburgh . <p/>Jackson is due in court Feb . 17 . <p/>He was on probation for a previous DUI arrest , the CHP said . <p/>Williams , an 11 - year veteran , shared the team ’ s MVP Award with quarterback Philip Rivers this season .

marked_doc: Chargers WR Jackson will play vs. Steelers <p/>An arrest for suspicion of driving under the influence will not affect the playing status of San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson for Sunday 's divisional <mark id="mark_id"> playoff </mark> game at Pittsburgh . <p/>Jackson was arrested on the DUI charge early Tuesday morning by the California Highway Patrol . <p/>However , the fourth-year wide receiver likely will not face disciplinary action until the 2009 season . <p/>An NFL spokesman on Wednesday said the league will await a determination by the court before considering disciplinary action against Jackson . <p/>Along with the misdemeanor DUI allegation , California Highway Patrol Officer Brad Baehr said Jackson was cited for driving on probation for a prior DUI . <p/>Jackson issued a statement released through the team . <p/>`` I was stopped by an officer , '' he said . <p/>`` I do n't think any charges will be filed as a result of the stop . <p/>In the event they are , I look forward to clearing my name and proving my innocence . '' <p/>Baehr said he was not aware of the particulars of the previous DUI charge and that results of Jackson 's blood test are pending . <p/>Jackson had his finest season in 2008 with with 59 receptions for 1,098 yards and seven touchdowns for the AFC West champions . <p/>`` We 're aware of the off-the-field issue involving Vincent , '' team general manager A.J. Smith said in a statement . <p/>`` Obviously we 're disappointed . <p/>We take these issues very seriously . <p/>Moving forward , we will monitor the situation and have no further comment . ''

text: Despite his arrest on suspicion of driving under the influence early yesterday , Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson will play in Sunday 's AFC divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh .
marked_sentence: Despite his <mark id="mark_id"> arrest </mark> on suspicion of driving under the influence early yesterday , Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson will play in Sunday 's AFC divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh .
marked_doc: Jackson arrested on DUI charge <p/>Despite his <mark id="mark_id"> arrest </mark> on suspicion of driving under the influence early yesterday , Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson will play in Sunday 's AFC divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh . <p/>Jackson , 25 , was driving east on state Route 52 near Interstate 805 just after 2:30 a.m. when he was pulled over for an observed traffic violation , California Highway Patrol Officer Brad Baehr said . <p/>Jackson faces the misdemeanor DUI allegation as well as charges that he was driving on probation for a prior DUI in June 2006 , Baehr said . <p/>The results of a blood test are pending . <p/>Jackson proffered his innocence in a statement released yesterday afternoon . <p/>`` This morning I was stopped by an officer , '' Jackson said in the statement . <p/>`` I do n't think any charges will be filed as a result of the stop . <p/>In the event they are , I look forward to clearing my name and proving my innocence . '' <p/>The arrest will not affect Jackson 's status for Sunday 's game . <p/>The NFL 's collective bargaining agreement gives the league , not teams , authority to punish players for alcohol and substance abuses . <p/>Any discipline by the league would be meted out for the 2009 season , several sources said . <p/>A suspension certainly is possible . <p/>The NFL 's substance-abuse policy states : `` Discipline for a second or subsequent offense is likely to be a suspension , the duration of which may escalate for repeat offenses . '' <p/>Jared Allen , then with Kansas City , was suspended for the first four games of the 2007 season after being charged with DUI twice in one year . <p/>The NFL later reduced his suspension to two games . <p/>Chargers players had the day off yesterday . <p/>General Manager A.J. Smith issued the following statement on Jackson 's arrest : <p/>`` We 're aware of the off-the-field issue involving Vincent . <p/>Obviously , we 're disappointed . <p/>We take these issues very seriously . <p/>Moving forward , we will monitor the situation and have no further comment . '' <p/>Jackson was driving a 2008 GMC Sierra registered to him , Baehr said . <p/>He was booked into county jail and was released by 6 a.m. , Baehr said . <p/>Jackson , in his fourth season , caught a career-high 59 passes and led the team with 1,098 yards , also a career high . <p/>His seven receiving touchdowns were also a career best and second on the team . <p/>Earlier this week , Smith called Jackson a `` true professional '' and `` ultimate team player '' for how hard Jackson played even while not catching any passes . <p/>`` You win championships with players like Vincent Jackson , '' Smith said . <p/>The general manager has put an emphasis on character and avoiding off-the-field issues . <p/>The Chargers have not had any arrests become public this season and have been relatively trouble-free in recent years . <p/>In 2006 , linebacker Steve Foley was shot by an off-duty Coronado policeman who suspected Foley of driving under the influence . <p/>Foley pleaded guilty to misdemeanor drunken driving and was placed on five years ' probation . <p/>In July , he settled a lawsuit against the city of Coronado for $ 5.5 million . <p/>Jackson 's contract runs through 2009 , and he is among the hottest young receivers in the league . <p/>What becomes of this incident , combined with the previous DUI , could affect Jackson 's long-term future with the Chargers . <p/>Smith has let go a number of players who have had off-the-field troubles . <p/>While none was as productive or possessed the upside of Jackson , Smith did last February release tackle Shane Olivea just two years after signing Olivea to a contract that guaranteed him $ 9 million . <p/>Olivea later underwent treatment for an addiction to pain killers . <p/>`` You 're a Charger one year at a time , '' Smith has often said . <p/>Recently , speaking of the lack of incidents involving his players , Smith said , `` It 's very important if you want to be a Charger you do the right things on and off the field . '' <p/>The Chargers leave Friday for Pittsburgh , where they will face the Steelers at 1:45 p.m. Sunday .

marked_doc: CHARGERS ' RECEIVER ARRESTED <p/>San Diego Chargers wide receiver Vincent Jackson was <mark id="mark_id"> arrested </mark> yesterday on suspicion of drunken driving . <p/>Jackson failed sobriety tests shortly after 2 a.m. local time on state Route 52 , California Highway Patrol Officer Ray Scheidnes said . <p/>Jackson was on probation for a previous similar arrest , he said . <p/>Jackson , in a statement released through the NFL team , said he did n't think charges would be filed against him . <p/>`` In the event they are , I look forward to clearing my name and proving my innocence , '' he said .

text: The Philadelphia 76ers fired coach Maurice Cheeks on Saturday , one day after the team continued its slide with a season-worst offensive effort , dpa reported .
marked_sentence: The Philadelphia 76ers <mark id="mark_id"> fired </mark> coach Maurice Cheeks on Saturday , one day after the team continued its slide with a season-worst offensive effort , dpa reported .
marked_doc: The Philadelphia 76ers <mark id="mark_id"> fired </mark> coach Maurice Cheeks on Saturday , one day after the team continued its slide with a season-worst offensive effort , dpa reported . <p/>Expected by many to be one of the top teams in the Eastern Conference , the 76ers have opened 9-14 with eight losses in their last 10 games , including Friday 's dispirited 88-72 setback at Cleveland . <p/>Cheeks was replaced on an interim basis by assistant general manager Tony DiLeo , a long-time member of the team 's front office. DiLeo will coach the Sixers in Saturday 's game at Washington and is expected to remain coach for the rest of the season . <p/>A year ago , the Sixers fired president Billy King and replaced him with Ed Stefanski , who gave Cheeks a one-year contract extension through the 2008-09 season and another one-year extension earlier this year , after Philadelphia used a second-half surge to make the playoffs for the first time since 2005 . <p/>`` Decisions of this nature are never easy , and this was particularly difficult due to the great amount of respect I have for Maurice Cheeks , '' Stefanski said . <p/>`` However , at this time I felt that it is in the best interest of this team to make a change while there is still time to accomplish the goals we set forth for ourselves at the start of the season . '' <p/>In the off-season , Stefanski landed free agent forward Elton Brand and reinked young stars Andre Iguodala and Louis Williams to long- term deals . <p/>The addition of Brand was supposed to transform Philadelphia into a contender . <p/>However , Brand and Iguodala have had difficulty getting their games to mesh . <p/>Cheeks has had disagreements with starting centre Samuel Dalembert , benching him for long stretches . <p/>The team heard boos in Wednesday 's home loss to Cleveland . <p/>A Philadelphia fixture who spent his first 11 seasons as a player with the 76ers and had his number-10 jersey retired by the club , Cheeks is 122-147 in three-plus seasons as head coach in the City of Brotherly Love . <p/>Cheeks came to Philadelphia from Portland , where he was 162-139 with two postseason appearances in three-plus seasons . <p/>DiLeo has never been an NBA coach . <p/>He was a scout and assistant coach before moving into management as director of player personnel in 1999 . <p/>He became assistant GM in 2003 . <p/>DiLeo played and coached for 10 seasons in West Germany and was named coach of the year in 1987 in the top West German league . <p/>`` Tony DiLeo has a wealth of basketball knowledge and coaching experience - both in the NBA and on the international level - and is familiar not only with our current group of players but the style of play we are striving to attain on a consistent basis , '' Stefanski said . <p/>Cheeks is the fifth coach fired this season , after PJ Carlesimo of Oklahoma City , Eddie Jordan of Washington , Sam Mitchell of Toronto and Randy Wittman of Minnesota . <p/>There is speculation that Stefanski may reach out to Jordan , as the two worked together with the New Jersey Nets earlier this decade .

text: Philadelphia 76ers management had enough of the NBA team lurking near the bottom of the Eastern Conference standings and fired head coach Maurice Cheeks on Saturday .
marked_sentence: Philadelphia 76ers management <mark id="mark_id"> had enough </mark> of the NBA team lurking near the bottom of the Eastern Conference standings and fired head coach Maurice Cheeks on Saturday .
marked_doc: Philadelphia 76ers management <mark id="mark_id"> had enough </mark> of the NBA team lurking near the bottom of the Eastern Conference standings and fired head coach Maurice Cheeks on Saturday . <p/>Assistant general manager Tony DiLeo was named interim coach . <p/>`` Decisions of this nature are never easy , and this was particularly difficult due to the great amount of respect I have for Maurice Cheeks , '' team president and general manager Ed Stefanski said . <p/>`` However , at this time I felt that it is in the best interest of this team to make a change while there is still time to accomplish the goals we set forth for ourselves at the start of the season . '' <p/>The 76ers dropped their third game in a row on Friday , an 88-72 setback to Cleveland , and occupy last place in the Atlantic Division with a 9-14 record . <p/>Cheeks would become the fifth NBA coach fired this season , along with P.J. Carlesimo ( Oklahoma City ) , Eddie Jordan ( Washington ) , Sam Mitchell ( Toronto ) and Randy Wittman ( Minnesota ) . <p/>The former 76ers point guard for much of the 1980s came back to the city to assume coaching duties prior to the 2005 season . <p/>Last season he led the club to their first postseason berth in four years . <p/>Cheeks has an overall record of 284-286 , which includes nearly four years as coach of Portland . <p/>Stefanski had given Cheeks two contract extensions in the past season , but the slow start was enough to cost him his job . <p/>The Sixers have hardly resembled last season 's up-tempo group that advanced to the playoffs , despite the addition of free agent Elton Brand . <p/>DiLeo has spent 19 seasons with the 76ers and was promoted to senior vice president and assistant general manager in 2003 . <p/>Prior to joining the organization he had amateur coaching experience . <p/>Philadelphia host the Washington Wizards on Saturday .

text: The Philadelphia 76ers fired Coach Maurice Cheeks Saturday morning after a disappointing 9-14 start to the 2008-09 season .
marked_sentence: The Philadelphia 76ers fired Coach Maurice Cheeks Saturday morning after a <mark id="mark_id"> disappointing </mark> 9-14 start to the 2008-09 season .
marked_doc: The Philadelphia 76ers fired Coach Maurice Cheeks Saturday morning after a <mark id="mark_id"> disappointing </mark> 9-14 start to the 2008-09 season . <p/>The Sixers had a three-game losing streak going into Saturday night 's contest against Washington , and more had been expected from a team that signed free-agent forward Elton Brand to a five-year , $ 80 million contract in the off-season . <p/>`` I made the decision because I felt we were not progressing the way we wanted to progress , '' said general manager Ed Stefanski at a news conference . <p/>`` I feel on the floor we were n't executing the philosophy that we want to have as Sixers basketball . '' <p/>Stefanski said Tony DiLeo , the team 's assistant general manager and senior vice president , will coach the team the rest of this season . <p/>Excluding Brand 's 15.9 points and 10 rebounds , the team 's stars have not played up to past standards . <p/>Andre Miller is averaging 15.5 points per game , Andre Iguodala 14.9 points , a drop of five points per game from last season , while Samuel Dalembert is down almost five points per game with his 5.8 points and just over two rebounds . <p/>Cheeks compiled a 162-139 record in three-plus seasons and coached the 76ers to 40 regular-season victories in 2007-08 before a six-game loss to Detroit in the Eastern Conference quarterfinals . <p/>He is the fifth NBA head coach fired this season , joining Oklahoma City 's P.J.Carlesimo , Washington 's Eddie Jordan , Toronto 's Sam Mitchell and Minnesota 's Randy Wittman .

text: Maurice Cheeks is out as Philadelphia 76ers head coach .
marked_sentence: Maurice Cheeks is <mark id="mark_id"> out </mark> as Philadelphia 76ers head coach .
marked_doc: Maurice Cheeks is <mark id="mark_id"> out </mark> as Philadelphia 76ers head coach . <p/>General manager Ed Stefanski announced Tony DiLeo , the team 's assistant general manager and senior vice president , will take over as the head coach for the remainder of the season . <p/>Stefanski fired Cheeks with the Sixers floundering at 9-14 and in the basement of the Eastern Conference 's Atlantic Division . <p/>As recently as a season ago , when speaking about Cheeks ' new contract extension , Stefanski said , `` we are excited about the future under this direction . '' <p/>That changed dramatically on Saturday . <p/>`` I made the decision because I felt we were not progressing the way we wanted to progress , `` said Stefanski . <p/>`` I feel on the floor we were n't executing the philosophy that we want to have as Sixers basketball . <p/>I told Mo we needed to go in a different direction and make a change . <p/>He was very gracious about it . <p/>He 's a Sixer and is rooting for us to turn this around . '' <p/>This past offseason , the Sixers bolstered their youthful , athletic roster with frontline cornerstone Elton Brand , who is leading the team in scoring ( 15.9 ) and rebounding ( 10.0 ) but is significantly short of his career scoring average and has already missed time this season due to injury . <p/>The expectations were high for a team that won 40 games and took Detroit to six games in the Eastern Conference quarterfinal round last season . <p/>Cheeks did not meet them . <p/>Friday night 's 88-72 loss in Cleveland , the team 's eighth in 10 games , was apparently the last straw. Cheeks is the fifth NBA head coach to be fired this season . <p/>`` I believe in this team . <p/>We are better than this , `` said Stefanski . <p/>`` We are going to make it better . <p/>We will find a way to improve on this team. `` <p/>The member of the Sixers ' 1982-83 NBA championship team started his head coaching career in Portland , where he finished with a 162-139 mark and a pair of playoff appearances . <p/>He guided a transition in Philadelphia from the Allen Iverson era and won more games than expected last season behind a rising star , Andre Iguodala , a young frontcourt led by Samuel Dalembert and a veteran presence at point guard , Andre Miller . <p/>Miller is averaging 15.5 points per game this season , but Iguodala is averaging just 14.9 points per contest , a drop of five points per game from last season . <p/>Dalembert is down almost five points per game ( 5.8 ppg ) and just over two rebounds ( 8.0 ) per contest . <p/>DiLeo is in his 19th season with the Sixers basketball operations department . <p/>He spent four seasons as the team 's director of personnel ( 1999-2003 ) before being promoted to senior VP and assistant GM in September 2003 .

text: In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise history .
marked_sentence: In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers <mark id="mark_id"> fired </mark> Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise history .
marked_doc: http : / / sports . espn . go . com / nba / news / story ? id=2066717 <p/>Mo Cheeks will take over as new coach <p/>Updated : May 24 , 2005 , 3 : 23 PM ET <p/>Maurice Cheeks is running the show again for the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers <mark id="mark_id"> fired </mark> Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise history . <p/>"Mo is family . <p/>Mo bleeds 76ers . He bleeds Philadelphia , " team president Billy King said . <p/>Cheeks will be introduced as Philadelphia's 21st head coach at a Tuesday news conference . <p/>Philadelphia is certainly banking on the former point guard to have a happier homecoming than O'Brien , a Philadelphia native who played for Saint Joseph's . <p/>O'Brien's stubbornness and seemingly unwavering belief in a system that didn't fit his players cost him his job despite a 43 - 39 record and a return to the playoffs . <p/>"I just felt the direction we were going and the overall play wasn't where we wanted to go , " King said . <p/>O'Brien just finished the first year of a three - year deal that included an option and paid him about $4 million a year . <p/>O'Brien , though , was not very popular with his players - - most notably former All - Star Chris Webber - - who often complained about their roles . <p/>King said after the Sixers were eliminated in the first round of the playoffs by Detroit that he planned to bring O'Brien back . <p/>After meeting with his players and other members of management , King had a change of heart and decided over the weekend he had to make a change . <p/>Certainly , King knows a thing or two about making changes - - Cheeks will be the fifth Sixers coach in four years under his watch . <p/>Larry Brown left for Detroit following the 2002 - 03 season , and assistant Randy Ayers was promoted and fired 52 games into the 2003 - 04 season before he was replaced by Chris Ford . <p/>"I knew this thing was coming , and it wasn't an easy thing for anybody , " Brown said from Miami before coaching the Pistons in the Eastern Conference finals . <p/>"Knowing Billy , it's not easy to let a coach go . <p/>His relationship with Randy was pretty strong . <p/>I think it was hard for him to let Chris go . <p/>He was excited about having Jimmy , but I don't think it ever gets easy . " <p/>Cheeks was one of the most popular 76ers from 1978 - 89 and played on Philadelphia's last championship team in 1983 . <p/>He also spent seven seasons as an assistant coach for the 76ers , was part of the staff under Brown when they went to the NBA Finals in 2001 and developed a strong bond with Allen Iverson . <p/>Cheeks was fired March 2 after nearly four seasons as coach of the Trail Blazers . <p/>He had a 162 - 139 record in Portland , the fourth - highest win total in Blazers history . <p/>Cheeks guided the team to the playoffs his first two seasons , but the players hardly made Cheeks' tenure easy - - on or off the court . <p/>The team was nicknamed the "Jail Blazers" after several brushes with the law , many of them involving marijuana possession . <p/>"If players have problems with Mo Cheeks . . . then there's got to be something wrong with those players , " King said . <p/>But Cheeks' return to the city where he was a four - time All - Star shouldn't come as a surprise . <p/>The Trail Blazers turned down Philadelphia's request to speak to Cheeks as a possible replacement for Brown , but the former point guard always remained popular with Philly fans and was at the top of the Sixers' short list to take over for Ford . <p/>Now , they'll get their wish . <p/>"We do not want to change coaches [ again ] , " Sixers chairman Ed Snider said . <p/>"We've seen enough coaches . " <p/>The Sixers will pay Ayers , O'Brien and Cheeks next season . <p/>"I don't think it's something we're very proud of , but I don't think it reflects poorly , " Snider said . <p/>O'Brien is the son - in - law of Hall of Fame coach Jack Ramsay . <p/>He led the Sixers to a 10 - win improvement from a year ago and they returned to the playoffs , largely on the back of a healthy , happy Iverson . <p/>While O'Brien avoided public spats with Iverson , he did not have the full support of the rest of the team . <p/>Some of the younger players , like Samuel Dalembert and Willie Green , felt they did not develop like they should have under O'Brien and were unsure about their roles . <p/>"In looking at the development of some of them , yeah , I wasn't pleased , " King said . <p/>The Sixers also failed to really understand O'Brien's defense , a sticking point even in the postseason . <p/>"Some of the criteria on our defense wasn't there , " King said . <p/>Cheeks , who once famously came to the rescue of a 13 - year - old girl who forgot the words to the national anthem before a playoff game , now hopes to bail out his former team and bring them another championship . <p/>"Mo has played this game here in Philadelphia , won a championship here in Philadelphia , understands players , understands defenses , understands the way I think we want to play , " King said .

text: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach .
marked_sentence: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was <mark id="mark_id"> fired </mark> Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach .
marked_doc: Not because Mo Cheeks was long for the job with the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>Like all coaches not in the upper stratosphere of the coaching hierarchy -- your Phil Jacksons and Gregg Popoviches -- he was only as good as his last 10-game stretch , only as secure as how well his star was playing . <p/>But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was <mark id="mark_id"> fired </mark> Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach . <p/>This was n't P.J. Carlesimo ( Oklahoma City ) or Eddie Jordan ( Washington ) , whose team 's putrid won-loss records sank any chance they had of survival . <p/>This was n't Sam Mitchell ( Toronto ) , whose differences of opinion with his general manager about his team 's personnel were too big to overcome . <p/>This was n't Randy Wittman ( Minnesota ) , whose fan base was staying away in droves as the paying public grew indifferent to the on-court product . <p/>The timing of this move by team president and general manager Ed Stefanski was a head-scratcher . <p/>`` It 's not 100 percent on the coach , '' a source with knowledge of the 76ers ' thinking said Saturday afternoon . <p/>`` But at the same time , we did n't seem to have a plan . '' <p/>Stefanski named assistant general manager Tony DiLeo coach for the rest of the season . <p/>DiLeo has a good reputation as a coach , spending time over the last two decades on the Sixers ' bench as an assistant and in Europe as a head coach . <p/>But unless circumstances change dramatically , Jordan -- who became close with Stefanski while both were in New Jersey earlier this decade -- will be the odds-on favorite to get the job permanantly . <p/>Many league execs still think quite highly of Jordan , and none of the players who matter in Washington threw Jordan under the bus after he was fired . <p/>Cheeks ' coaching moves have frequently been criticized over the years , both in Philadelphia and in Portland . <p/>But he lost his job this time not only because of Xs and Os , but because so many of the 76ers ' players that blossomed under him last season , including center Sam Dalembert , forward Andre Iguodala and guard Lou Williams , struggled to get going this season . <p/>And the moves Cheeks made , like benching second-year forward Thaddeus Young and elevating guard Willie Green , have n't produced enough dividends . <p/>`` Ed just was n't seeing any progress , '' the source said , and Stefanski expected more from a team that had signed free agent Elton Brand to an $ 82 million deal and re-signed core players Iguodala and Williams for $ 80 million and $ 25 million , respectively . <p/>`` We were n't progressing at the rate [ Stefanski ] thought we should , and he thought it was time for a move , '' the source said . <p/>Yet Stefanski can not escape criticism , either . <p/>Bringing Brand in was the signing coup of the NBA offseason , to be sure . <p/>But in doing that , Stefanski changed the team 's footprint . <p/>The Sixers are still a very good transition team . <p/>But when the game slows down , having to cater to Brand leaves the lane clogged . <p/>Last season , Iguodala , Young and Williams had driving room when Philly ran its halfcourt sets , and Dalembert showed occasional decent low-post play . <p/>But now , Brand is the man in the paint , forcing everyone else out on the perimeter . <p/>Left to fend for himself on the weakside , Dalembert 's numbers have plummeted , and Williams has just begun to play well . <p/>Brand is recovered from the Achilles ' injury that kept him out of all but eight games last season with the Clippers , but he 's been slowed by a bad hamstring , and his offensive numbers ( 15.9 points , a career-low .436 from the floor ) have been unspectactular . <p/>No matter what the stats say , Philly looks and plays slower this season . <p/>And Stefanski did n't get a big-time shooter who could stretch the court and take pressure off of Brand inside . <p/>Veterans Donyell Marshall and Kareem Rush , signed later in the summer by Philly , do n't strike much fear into opposing teams . <p/>The result is Philly 's 93.3 scoring average , 28th in the league ( only Charlotte and Oklahoma City have scored 100 points fewer times than Philadelphia 's six ) , and .314 percentage behind the three-point line , 26th in the league . <p/>`` Everybody zones them , '' an Eastern Conference executive said Saturday . <p/>The Sixers had just scored one of their more impressive victories eight days ago , rallying from a double-digit deficit in the second half to win on the road at Detroit . <p/>True , they had bad losses early to the Bobcats and Timberwolves , and lost a home-and-home to the Cavaliers on Wednesday and Friday . <p/>But last we checked , Cleveland was 20-3 , owner of an 11-game win streak and the only remaining undefeated team at home this season . <p/>The Cavs are rolling , and losing to them is no embarassment . <p/>Another league source with knowledge of the team 's thinking said Saturday that the Cleveland losses played no role in Cheeks 's firing . <p/>Cheeks received his second one-year contract extension in less than a year last September , taking him through the 2009-10 season . <p/>While Stefanski did n't hire Cheeks ( that was former president Billy King , whom Stefanski replaced early last season ) , Stefanski and Cheeks had quickly established a solid , working relationship with one another . <p/>Cheeks quickly acquiesced last year when Stefanski asked him to give more time to the team 's younger players , getting Young and young vets Rodney Carney and Williams bigger minutes . <p/>The transition transformed the team , as the 76ers went on a 19-7 run last spring , turning opponents over and becoming deadly in transition . <p/>They rode their hot streak into the playoffs , where they stretched Detroit to six games before succumbing in the first round . <p/>They were n't a finished product , though , and it was no secret that Brand was Stefanski 's target , just as he 'd been King 's ultimate target . <p/>After a brief dalliance with Atlanta free agent Josh Smith , So Stefanski cleared as much cap room as possible , sending Carney and center Calvin Booth to Minnesota , and then struck , getting Brand to spurn his former team , the Clippers , as well as the Warriors , for the Sixers ' $ 80 million offer -- the `` Philly Max , '' as Brand later called it . <p/>After keeping Iguodala and Williams , all the heat was on Cheeks . <p/>Saturday , he became the latest coach -- one-sixth of the league 's head men already gone in little more than five weeks -- to succumb to the pyre .

text: Philadelphia 76ers Fire Coach Jim O'Brien , Hire Maurice Cheeks
marked_sentence: Philadelphia 76ers <mark id="mark_id"> Fire </mark> Coach Jim O'Brien , Hire Maurice Cheeks
marked_doc: http : / / www . insidehoops . com / obrien - cheeks - 052305 . shtml <p/>Philadelphia 76ers <mark id="mark_id"> Fire </mark> Coach Jim O'Brien , Hire Maurice Cheeks <p/>May 23 , 2005 <p/>Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced today that Jim O'Brien has been relieved of his duties as head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>No decision has been reached on O'Brien's staff at this time . <p/>O'Brien was hired as the 20th coach of the 76ers on April 21 , 2004 and posted a record of 43 - 39 in 2004 - 05 . <p/>Overall , in five seasons as an NBA head coach , O'Brien recorded a mark of 182 - 158 ( . 535 ) , including a record of 139 - 119 ( . 539 ) with the Boston Celtics from 2000 - 04 . <p/>O'Brien has served on the coaching staffs at seven different universities , including head coaching positions at Wheeling Jesuit College ( 1982 - 87 ) and University of Dayton ( 1989 - 94 ) . <p/>He owns a 135 - 156 ( . 464 ) record at the collegiate level in 10 seasons as a head coach . <p/>Also today , Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced that Maurice Cheeks has been hired as the 21st head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>Cheeks arrives in Philadelphia after three - plus seasons as head coach of the Portland Trail Blazers . <p/>He recorded a mark of 162 - 139 ( . 538 ) in Portland , the fourth - highest win total in Blazers history . <p/>During his time in Portland , the Blazers reached the NBA Playoffs twice , and his 2002 - 03 squad tied for second in the Pacific Division with a 50 - 32 record . <p/>He joined the Blazers on June 27 , 2001 , after serving seven seasons as an assistant coach for the 76ers . <p/>Cheeks worked under head coaches John Lucas ( 1994 - 96 ) , Johnny Davis ( 1996 - 97 ) , and Larry Brown ( 1997 - 2001 ) . <p/>In 2000 - 01 under Brown , Cheeks helped guide the 76ers to a record of 56 - 26 ( . 683 ) and a spot in the NBA Finals . <p/>Cheeks , 48 , logged an impressive 15 - year NBA career , spending 11 seasons in Philadelphia . <p/>The four - time All - Star ( 1983 , '86 , '87 , '88 ) helped guide the 76ers to 10 playoff appearances , including a World Championship in 1983 . <p/>In 133 career playoff games , he averaged 14 . 4 points , 6 . 9 assists , and 3 . 4 rebounds while shooting 51 . 2 percent from the field . <p/>Cheeks is also a five - time NBA All - Defensive Team honoree . <p/>The native of Chicago , Ill . , he averaged 11 . 1 points , 6 . 7 assists and 2 . 1 steals in 1 , 101 career games while shooting 52 . 3 percent from the field and 79 . 3 percent from the charity stripe . <p/>He retired in 1993 as the league's all - time leader in steals , and was fifth on the career assists list at that time . <p/>Currently , he ranks fourth in steals and eighth in assists all - time . <p/>Cheeks had his No . 10 76ers jersey retired on Feb . 6 , 1995 . <p/>The 1978 product of West Texas State was a four - year starter and three - time team MVP in college . <p/>He finished his collegiate career third on the Buffalos' all - time scoring list , averaging 16 . 8 points per game . <p/>Cheeks was selected in the second round of the 1978 NBA Draft ( 36th overall pick ) by the 76ers .

marked_doc: The Eastern Conference standings have claimed another coach , with Philadelphia 76ers head man Maurice Cheeks <mark id="mark_id"> joining </mark> the ever-growing list of coaches who are no longer employed . <p/>The 2008-09 season was supposed to be a good one for the Sixers , who claimed the summer 's top free agent prize in Elton Brand and then assured that their big three would be together long-term by re-signing Anre Iguodala . <p/>Unfortunately , it has n't played out that way to date . <p/>Currently sitting at 9-14 on the season , the only thing stopping Philly from being complete buried in the standings is that so many Eastern Conference teams are struggling , as well . <p/>Despite their poor start and their current three-game losing streak - likely to end tonight as the team takes on the Wizards - the Sixers are still just two games in the loss column behind the eighth seed in the East . <p/>Cheeks marks the third Eastern Conference head coach to get fired this season , following in the footsteps of the Toronto Raptors ' Sam Mitchell and the Washington Wizards ' Eddie Jordan . <p/>Cheeks will be succeeded by Assistant GM Tony DiLeo .

Smith has reported that the Philadelphia 76ers have <mark id="mark_id"> parted ways </mark> with coach Maurice Cheeks . <p/>The 76ers have a record of 9-14 and had been expected to be a playoff team in the Eastern Conference . <p/>With its acquisition of free agent Elton Brand the lineup seemed to be become more solid especially in the middle . <p/>But Brand has not found his rhythm in the offense and his numbers have been disappointing . <p/>Some have said that instead of being the missing piece , that not unlike the Phoenix Suns , the team has missed its run and gun offense from last season . <p/>When Philly landed a playoff spot near the bottom of the East 's pile this past spring and then surprised the Pistons by taking the first two games from them in Detroit before losing the next four straight , there were high hopes for .500 + season and an upgrade in the playoff seedings . <p/>With Brand 's arrival the hope turned into what fans thought was a reality . <p/>Never before in NBA history have coaches fallen this early in the season in such numbers . <p/>Veteran players know all too well that the security their union has fought for has created an imbalance of power on teams that do n't have a proven winner in the coaching seat . <p/>When a player is paid tens of millions of dollars by a franchise , he is in the driver 's seat and if it comes down to a contest between that player and a coach who has n't won a title or has n't won a title in a long while , it 's not hard to know who has to go . <p/>Do n't cry for Cheeks on the financial front. He has a guaranteed contract through the end of the 2009-2010 season .

marked_doc: http : / / sports . espn . go . com / nba / news / story ? id=2115562 <p/>Agent says Sixers to sign Dalembert to six - year deal <p/>July 25 , 2005 , 12 : 18 AM ET <p/>Samuel Dalembert agreed to a six year deal with the Philadelphia 76ers on Saturday , his agent Marc Cornstein , told ESPN . com . <p/>Cornstein refused to disclose the amount of the contract , but it's believed to be worth between $60 million to $70 million , based on previous negotiations . <p/>The signing came just one day before Dalembert was set to get on a plane and visit the Atlanta Hawks , who had the money under the cap to pay him a maximum five - year , $70 million offer . <p/>Of the three top big men on the market , Dalembert was the center with the most upside . <p/>He has great range and is athletic , with great shot blocking instincts . <p/>He's shown he can be a volume rebounder and his offensive game is emerging . <p/>He was very inconsistent at times this season , but in the playoffs against the Detroit Pistons , he played the part of a franchise center . <p/>The Sixers made a power move this offseason , <mark id="mark_id"> firing </mark> head coach Jim O'Brien , who wasn't a Dalembert fan , and replacing him with Mo Cheeks , who is . <p/>Philly let it be known that O'Brien was fired , in part , because the Sixers are committed to Dalembert . <p/>This is the third deal for the Sixers this summer . <p/>They also reached six - year deals with Kyle Korver for $25 million and with Willie Green for about $20 million .
